Right now she is selling tuna; soon she will begin to sell cochinillo, which is a small bug found on the cactus plants and used to make red dyes.

Felicitas is 46 years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of 17 and 29. Felicitas travels to different markets around the region buying grains that she then sells in Ayacucho along with selling clothing. Two months ago she also started selling fresh orange juice on one of the main streets of Ayacucho.

Mercedes, Delia, and Felicitas need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in the purchase of fruits, tuna, oranges, and a nicer juicer.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Mercedes, Delia, and Felicitas are all saving to pay for their childrens education. Mercedes and Felicitas have daughters in university, one studying nursing and the other anthropology. Delia has a daughter about to start her first year of college. Their dreams are for their children to have a better life.

loan.use: Mercedes, Delia, and Felicitas need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in the purchase of fruits, tuna, oranges, and a nicer juicer.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. has worked as a trader for the past 20 years. She is married, has five children and makes a living selling food, mineral water and clothing at the Cape Coast University science market. She is requesting a loan of $425 to expand her selection of goods by buying more clothing and food items to sell. Mary is a member of the Anointing Group, which is made up of 10 borrowers who live in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loan.use: To buy clothing and food items to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina A. is married and has one child. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She helps support her family by selling jeans, hand bags, and sleepwear at Cape Coast University. She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a wider variety of bags and jeans so that she can attract more customers. In addition to running this small business, Helina is a member of the Anointing Group, which is made up of 10 borrowers who live in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loan.use: To buy a wider variety of hand bags and jeans.

loan.name: Emigdio

texts.en:
Emigdio S. is a 55-year-old husband and father of two. One of his sons is in college, while the other was able to graduate from college and is now successful in the working world. Emigdio did not have the opportunity that he has given his sons, so without a higher degree, he began his own business.

His business is selling bedding, sheets, blankets, and quilts, along with hammocks. The hammock is a typical product of this area. Emigdio will invest the loan in more products for his store, because he knows that variety of products will make his business more competitive.

loan.use: To buy sheets, blankets, quilts, and other bedding.

loan.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina G. has been a seamstress for the last four years, and supplements her income by selling vegetables at the Cape Coast University science market. She is married and has one child. Augustina is requesting a loan of $425 to buy cloth, sewing products and vegetables to help expand her two small businesses. In addition to running these small companies, Augustina is a member of the Anointing Group, which is made up of 10 borrowers who live in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loan.use: To buy cloth, sewing products and vegetables.

loan.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a young single man with no children. He is licensed in business administration and, after graduating, began his own business. He now owns a small hamburger restaurant where he has a simple menu of great food.

Luis has been in business now for five years and, over time, he has created a great clientele and reputation in the area. He is looking for a loan to help him purchase more drinks, meat for burgers, and bread. He is hoping that soon he will be able to hire more people and increase the number of customers.

loan.use: To buy drinks, baked goods, meats, and vegetables for the production of his hamburgers.

loan.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. is a 41-year-old mother of five. Three of her children are still attending school and the two eldest live outside of the house. In order to open her business, she worked in Argentina as a maid for a few years, while her husband worked as a bricklayer. When she saved enough capital to invest, she returned to her home town of Roque and opened a small convenience store.

In order to maintain strong incomes, she wishes to take a loan to increase the goods that she buys for her store. By buying in bulk, she can lower the prices of her goods and keep her customers satisfied.

loan.use: To buy flour, rice, yerba, pasta, and other goods.

loan.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro C. is a 54-year-old man who is married with four children. All of his children live outside the house and he is now working to support himself and his wife. When Pedro was younger, he worked as a traveling salesman and repaired couches and chairs. His wife is a crafter and works making blankets and quilts.

Together they work making goods and selling various things. The loan they are asking for is to increase the amount of material they have in the hopes that their business continues to grow.

loan.use: To buy blankets, thread, and other supplies for work.

loan.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is married, has three children and makes a living preparing and selling food. Demand for her cooking is high, and she believes this is a good time to expand her small business. She is seeking a loan of $525 to buy additional cooking materials.

loan.use: To buy additional cooking supplies.

loan.name: Savina

texts.en: Savina A. is married, has four children and makes a living preparing and selling food. She wants to attract more customers by increasing the supplies of food she has to sell. She is asking for a loan of $525 to buy the additional cooking materials she needs to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business by buying additional cooking materials.

loan.name: Irma's Group

texts.en:
In the town of San Roque, near the city of Carepegua, there is a group of women who have come together and work to improve their small businesses. These women cut hair, sell goods for the house, make clothing and food, and run small convenience stores. The support each other working with Fundacin Paraguaya and taking out loans to help their businesses.

They are asking for a loan together to help them purchase ingredients, items in bulk, new clothing, and beauty supplies. Together they work to better their lives and the lives of their families.

loan.use: To buy clothing, food, ingredients, and other merchandise to sell.

loan.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia B. is married and has two children. She works as a trader, selling canned food and vegetables such as tomatoes and eggplant. Demand for her goods has increased recently, and she believes this is a good time to increase sales. She has applied for a loan of $525 to buy more vegetables, cooking oil and canned food to meet the needs of her customers.

loan.use: To buy more vegetables, cooking oil and canned food.

loan.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda, Olga, and Karen are members of the community bank Estrella. Yolanda and Karen have been members of the bank for close to five years, while Olga joined four months ago. In that time they have learned punctuality, and responsibility. They have also found companionship and solidarity among the other women in the bank.

Yolanda is 26 years old. She buys live animals and then sells the meat at the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She sells mainly beef and lamb. She has run this business for ten years.

Olga is 22. She lives with her partner and newborn son. Olga sells humitas, which are similar to a sweet tamale. She has a stand in the central market of Ayacucho. She has been selling humitas since she was young. She is planning to start selling salchipapa which is a typical dish made by topping french-fries with scrambled egg and sausage.

Karen is 23 years old. She has a business selling cosmetics from a catalogue. She takes orders from friends and families and travels nine hours to Lima once each month to buy the products. Now she is planning to start selling clothing as well.

Yolanda, Olga, and Karen each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy cows, sheep, corn, sugar, potatoes, eggs, oil, and to pay travel expenses.

Yolanda, Olga, and Karen dream of owning land, and building a home.

loan.use: Yolanda, Olga, and Karen each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy cows, sheep, corn, sugar, potatoes, eggs, oil, and to pay travel expenses.

loan.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida P. A. is married, has three children and makes a living preparing kenkey, a native food made from corn. This product is in high demand, and Vita wants to increase production to meet the needs of all of her costumers. She has applied for a loan of $525 to buy more corn and other materials needed to prepare kenkey.

loan.use: To buy more corn and other items used to prepare a local dish.

loan.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito is a 57 year old man, lives with his wife and children and makes a living providing taxi services with a vehicle that he owns.

Agapito has more than 18 years of experience in the area of public transport and concurrently his wife works in the rental of real estate.

Due to the time that he has in the business he has a steady customer base that appreciates his work, timeliness and service quality. These factors minimize the risks presented by his competition. The prices that he charges are in accordance to the norm for the area and the distances traveled.

The money will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle which is the basis of his work. His previous credit history is very good and currently he only has loans with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Agapito es un seor de 57 aos de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos y se dedica a prestar servicios de taxista con su movilidad que es propia.

Agapito tiene ms de 18 aos de experiencia en el rubro del transporte pblico y paralelamente la esposa trabaja ofertando alquiler de inmuebles.

Debido a la antiguedad con la que cuenta es que tiene clientela fija que aprecia su trabajo, puntalidad y buen trato, estos factores minimizan los riesgos que le puede presentar la competencia.

Los precios que maneja son de acuerdo a las tarifas que se manejan en el rubro y de acuerdo a las distancias recorridas.

El dinero ser utilizado para reparar y dar mantenimiento general a su movilidad que se constituye en su herramienta de trabajo.

Los antecedentes crediticios de Agapito son muy buenos, actualmente slo tiene crdito con nuestra Institucin.

loan.use: Repair and maintenance of his vehicle.

loan.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been a member of the community bank Cocharacas for two years. Through the community bank she learned to be responsible, punctual, how to educate her children, and to save.

Victoria is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Victoria lives in the district of Acosyinchos, which is 90 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho.

Together with her husband Victoria weaves a variety of products. She sells them to an intermediary and sometimes sells them in Ayacucho. She uses laborers to sell them at local markets.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she well use to buy wood and pay her laborers.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Victoria plans to use her savings to pay for her childrens education. Her dream is to own a home in the city of Ayacucho, and that her children will be professionals.

loan.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she well use to buy wood and pay her laborers.

loan.name: Marleney's Group

texts.en:
Marleney and Magna have been members of the community bank Estrellas for eight months. In that time they have learned how to manage their businesses more efficiently. They joined the community bank because the process was simplified and they receive more support.

Marleney is 23 years old. Marleney sells construction materials. She travels to a variety of regional markets to buy construction materials, which she then sells from her home. In addition, Marleney is an artisan weaver who makes beautiful blankets and tapestries. She has been weaving all of her life and learned this art from her parents. Marleney is also studying nursing at the local university.

Magna is 25 years old. She is the single mother of one son. Magna travels to both the Ayacuchan jungle and Lima, both of which are about eight hours away, where she buys and trades goods such as fruit, clothing, and potatoes.

Marleney and Magna need loans of 600 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use for buying construction materials, and a variety of other products.

One of the important aspects of the community bank is interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Marleney and Magna plan to use their savings to pay for their own education and for the education of their children. Their dreams are to be a good nurse and to help those who need it, and to own a home.

loan.use: Marleney and Magna need loans of 600 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use for buying construction materials, and a variety of other products.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret S. runs a small shop in which she sells soft drinks and prepares beverages and breakfast dishes for her customers. Demand for her products is high, and she would like to acquire more inventory to meet the needs of all of her customers. She has applied for a loan of $525 to buy more eggs, drinks and others items to sell.

loan.use: To buy eggs, beverages and other items to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Satu

texts.en: Satu Z. is married and has four children. She is a hawker who prepares food and then goes out to sell it to her customers. She wants to acquire a canteen so that she can sell her food in one place. She has applied for a loan $525 to make the purchase of the canteen possible.

loan.use: To buy a small canteen in which she can sell her food.

loan.name: Eleodora

texts.en:
Eleodora has been a member of the community bank Cocharacas for four months. Through the community bank she has learned to be responsible, have a healthy relationship with her husband, how to educate her children, and to save.

Eleodora is married and has seven children, four of whom live with her. Eleodora makes typical clothing, which is mainly used for festivals and parades. She makes sashes, blouses, and skirts, which she learned to do from her mother-in-law. Eleodora sells her products at various markets around Ayacucho.

Eleodora needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Eleodora plans to use her savings to educate her children and to construct her home. Her dream is to own a home, that her children will be professionals, and that she will have a secure job.

loan.use: Eleodora needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. is married and has five children. Her husband is a driver, and she makes a living preparing and selling Banku, a local dish made from corn that is very popular in Ghana. Demand for this food is very high, and Margaret could sell a lot more of it if she had additional supplies. She has applied for a loan of $525 to buy the additional supplies she needs to increase her food production and meet the needs of her customers.

loan.use: To buy additional ingredients to meet the needs of her customers.

loan.name: Orfelinda's Group

texts.en:
Orfelinda and Lucinda have been members of the community bank Cocharcas for eight months. Through their community bank they have learned how to have a healthy relationship with their children, how to avoid domestic violence, and to save.

Orfelinda is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children aged six and four. Orfelinda has been selling cheeses for one year from a cart outsiD. of the central market on the Ayacucho. In addition, Orfelinda knits beautiful sweaters that she sells at the markets in Ayacucho. Orfelinda is thinking of opening a business selling food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar from her home.

Lucinda is 42 years old. She lives with her partner and has four children. Lucinda sells cebiche, a typical dish maD. from marinating fish in lemon juice. She has been selling cebiche from one of the local markets for one year. Previously, Lucinda sold other foods at the market, but maD. a higher profit dedicating her self to cebiche. In addition, Lucinda also travels to the jungle region once every two weeks to sell fish.

Orfelinda and Lucinda need of 600, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy rice, noodles, sugar, oil, soap, and fish.

Orfelinda and Lucinda dream of buying a car which they could use as a taxi, building a home, that their children will be professionals, and that their businesses will continue to grow.

loan.use: Orfelinda and Lucinda need of 600, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy rice, noodles, sugar, oil, soap, and fish.

loan.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is 51 years old and he transports people around the citys radius. He uses his motorcycle as a mototaxi. At home his wife tends to her little artisan bakery in their home. This couple lives with their children in their own house, which is located near the Warnes stadium. Jose has worked in the area of public transportation for various years, and is part of the October 30 association. He also has a lot of experience with his wifes bakery, where she makes and sells the bread which is a primary staple. The competition in both fields is medium, but the antiquity of the work, the agreement with clients, the location, and the type of articulation that they offer are factors that helps them have a consistent clientele. Jose wants to buy a motorcycle for $600usd which is like the bike that can be seen in the photo. This is the 4th time he has barrowed money, and during that time he has proven to be a punctual and responsible with his repayments. At the moment he has no other debts or outstanding credit.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo Kiva volunteer

Jose tiene 51 aos de edad y es transportista de pasajeros en el radio urbano, maneja su moto para prestar sus servicios como mototaxista, por otra parte su esposa atiende su pequea panadera artesanal en su domicilio. Esta pareja vive con sus hijos en casa propia que se encuentra ubicada por la zona del stadium de Warnes, actualmente la casa no esta registrada a su nombre. Jose trabaja en el rubro del transporte pblico desde hace varios aos atrs, siendo parte tambin de la Asociacin 30 de Octubre, paralelamente tambin tienen bastante experiencia con la panadera que administra su esposa, donde ella elabora y comercializa el pan que es un artculo de primera necesidad. La competencia en ambos rubros es media, pero la antiguedad de trabajo, el trato a los clientes, la ubicacin y el tipo de artculo que ofrecen (pan) son factores que les ayuda a tener clientela constantemente. El cliente comprar una moto en $us. 600.- y que es exactamente la moto que se puede ver en la fotografa. Esta es la cuarta operacin de Jose con la instucin, y en este tiempo de relacin demostr ser una persona puntual y responsable en sus pagos. Actualmente no tiene deudas en otras financieras.

loan.use: Purchase of a Motorcycle

loan.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia S. has been a tailor for 25 years. She works in a sartorial factory but also does some tailoring work at home. Asia is married and lives with her family in Smolian, Bulgaria. Her husband works in a constructing company. Because Asia does so much work at home, she has applied for $775 (1,000 BGN) to buy a better sewing machine.

loan.use: To buy a better sewing machine.

loan.name: Verka

texts.en: Verka B. lives in the town of Smolian, Bulgaria. She has worked at a sartorial company for more than three years. Verka now has the opportunity to do some of her work at home for extra payment. The company supplies all the necessary materials, but she needs her own sewing machine to work at home. Therefore, Verka has applied for a loan of $775 (1,000 BGN) to buy a sewing machine.

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loan.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is 47 and is a single mother. She has always been a good cook, so when she decided to start her own business, selling food in her neighborhood was the clear choice. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead and send her two children to school. She lives in La Primavera, where her business is based. In her dining hall, she offers a wide variety of homemade foods to her customers every day, waiting on them herself. The majority of the people who come to enjoy her dishes are local workers.

Thanks to her business, Doris has been able to earn enough so that her family can have a decent home. However, she would like to be able to expand the business, in order to offer her clients a pleasant atmosphere. Doing this will enable her to educate her children so that they can find jobs, and to make more improvements to their home. Doris is seeking this loan so that she can purchase the perishable food items, meat and grains that she needs to prepare the foods that she makes every day.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Doris es madre soltera, tiene 47 aos de edad, siempre fue una buena cocinera as que cuando pens en un negocio que pudiera manejar decidi vender comida en su localidad, con su negocio es como ha salido adelante y educado a sus 2 hijos, habita en el barrio La Primavera, cuenta con un Comedor en el cual ofrece comida casera variada todos los das de la semana, posee un buen numero de clientes a quienes atiende, muchos trabajan en los alrededores de la zona y son quienes mayormente degustan de los platillos de la seora.

El negocio le ha generado suficientes ingresos para vivir dignamente con su familia. El deseo de la seora es de expandir su negocio, ofreciendo un ambiente agradable y tranquilo para todos sus clientes, ya que de esta forma podr formar a sus hijos como profesionales y mejorar la condicin habitacional de su vivienda. La seora solicita un prstamo para la compra de perecederos, carnes y granos bsicos que necesita para elaborar los alimentos que da a da ofrece.

loan.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation

loan.name: Tzonka

texts.en: Tzonka B. lives in the town of Smolian, Bulgaria. She was an accountant but three years ago started own business and founded a store which sells spare parts for cars. She started this business because her husband has a business selling second hand cars. Tzonkas husband helped her in the beginning, but now she works independently. She has applied for $775 (1,000 BGN) in order to repair her store.

loan.use: For repairing the store.

loan.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana M. works in a sartorial factory in the town of Smolian, Bulgaria. It is a common practice to be given extra work to do at home. Mariana has applied to do home work because it will allow her to earn extra payment and improve the financial situation of her family (Marianas husband is retired and she is the one that earns money for the family). Mariana needs $775 (1,000 BGN) to buy a sewing machine so she can work at home.

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loan.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman is 47 years old, and has a stable job at a milk processing plant. Additionally he is dedicated to the intermediary sale of cattle between ranchers and third party clients. Other work that he does to parallel his cattle trade is to rent out a light and sound system for special social events. Meanwhile, his wife works as a seamstress out of their home. Their family is made up of 5 people, him, his wife, and 3 children 16, 13, and 9. The couple has more than 21 years experience in their various activities, and as such the competition does affect them in any particular way. The prices they get for their goods are defined by the market (supply and demand) They have a very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Roman es un seor de 47 aos de edad, actualmente trabaja como empleado fijo de la Empresa de Lacteos PIL (Warnes), adicionalmente se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno como intermediario entre ganaderos y terceros comerciantes. Paralelamente cuenta con un sistema de luces y sonido que alquila en s zona para distintos eventos sociales, por otra parte su esposa cuenta con un taller de costura ubicado en su domicilio. Su familia est compuesta por 5 personas, l su esposa y sus tres hijos de 16, 13 y 9 aos respectivamente. La pareja tiene ms de 21 aos de experiencia en sus variadas actividades, por lo que la compencia si bien es media no les afecta de manera particular. Los precios con los que se manejan bsicamente son definidos por los del mercado (oferta y demanda). Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loan.use: Capital for work

loan.name: Bradis

texts.es:
Ms. Bradis is 32 and lives with her family in Hialeah. She has been selling cosmetics door-to-door for five years, visiting workplaces, universities, banks, etc. The income she makes from these sales goes towards covering her family's living expenses, including her three children, who are currently in school. Her husband works as a trucker driver for Petronic and has to spend a lot of time traveling outside of Nicaragua. Therefore, her business has brought them enough income to be able to support the family, while her husband's salary covers their basic housing costs. The family lives in good conditions, and Ms. Bradis' business has allowed her to make improvements to their home and further her goal of providing a decent and safe home for her children. At present, the family needs help in order to finish construction on their kitchen. They still need to build the floor and railings, and she is therefore seeking a loan to be able to finish off the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer.

Doa Bradis tiene 32 aos, habita con su familia en Hialeah, lleva 5 aos de dedicarse a vender cosmticos de manera ambulante, visita centros de trabajo, universidades, bancos entre otros, con esta actividad apoya en los gastos familiares y de sus 3 hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando, su esposo se desempea como conductor de pipa de Petronic, el cual permanece mayormente viajando fuera de Nicaragua. Es por eso que su negocio le ha generado suficientes ingresos para apoyar en la manutencin de su familia, los ingresos del seor permite pagar los servicios bsicos de la vivienda. Esta familia viven en condiciones estables, el mismo negocio le ha permitido a la seora ir acondicionando su vivienda con el objetivo de brindarles un techo digno y seguro a sus hijos, la necesidad en estos momentos es de terminar de construir la cocina, ya que le falta el piso y las verjas, es por eso que solicita un prstamo que le ayude a cerrar su cocina.

loan.use: Purchase of ceramic, cement, iron and cinder blocks

loan.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with two kids. He and his family live in Zaporozhye. Sergey owns a small van and offers transportation services in the city. He understands his role as the head and provider for his family, and is ready to work 24/7 to provide for the needs of his loved ones. He has been faithfully working in this business for 8 years.

Sergey has found his niche in this business. Today, its a lot harder to start your own business as a public van driver. Currently, Sergeys net profit is about $500 a month. An economical diesel engine in his vehicle helps him reduce his operating costs and adds to his bottom line. Loans that Sergey has received from Nadiya Ukraine have helped to promote stability and growth in his business. Sergey is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase necessary car parts and fix his van. He understands the effort and commitment it takes to be a private entrepreneur, and is willing to work hard in his business to be able to support his family which is the first priority in his life.

loan.use: To repair the van for his transportation service.

loan.name: Victoire

texts.fr:
Mrs. Victoire N. was born in 1981 in LADJI, a shantytown of COTONOU. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a professional hairdresser with good business ethics. In addition she sells products in line with her activity such as cosmetics, extensions and others. She is requesting a loan to improve the conditions of her performance and to answer the demand of her customers. We are reminded that this is her third loan and that she has a large experience in this area since she opened her salon 5 years ago.

Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Dame N. Victoire est ne vers 1981 LADJI un bidonville de COTONOU. Elle est marie et mre de trois enfants. De bonne moralit elle est coiffeuse de profession. En plus de celle-ci elle vend des produits qui entre en ligne de compte de son activit tels que les produits cosmtiques, les mches et autres. Elle sollicite ce prt pour amliorer les conditions de sa prestation et pour rpondre aux sollicitations de sa clientle. Rappelons quelle est son troisime prt et elle a une grande exprience dans le domaine puisqu'elle a ouvert son salon de beaut il y a 05 ans.

loan.use: Purchase of cosmetic products, extensions and others.

loan.name: Mariana Lucia

texts.es:
Mariana is 54 and lives with her son in Villa Flor de Managua. For the last five years she has been working for AHIMSA, an organization that provides free food, education and medicines to children from low income families in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

Mariana is the coordinator of AHIMSA's Family Social Program, and her social work with this program has contributed to the continued development of her community. What she earns for her work with this organization has been very beneficial, as it allows her to pay for her son's studies. He is currently studying to be able to obtain employment that will further his development. Mariana's husband currently works for Enacal [Nicaragua's state water and sewage utility]. Mariana and her husband have been working to improve their family's quality of life, and right now their most pressing need is to be able to finish construction on their house's porch. They have been unable to complete the project because they don't have the resources to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer.

Doa Mariana tiene 54 aos de edad, habita con su hijo en el barrio Villa Flor de Managua, hace 5 aos trabaja en una Asociacin llamada AHIMSA que opera en el barrio Memorial Sandino, en donde apadrinan a nios con padres de escasos recursos econmicos, brindndoles alimentacin, educacin y medicina gratuita.

Ella coordina el Programa Social Familiar que realiza esta asociacin, en donde su labor social ha contribuido al desarrollo integral de su comunidad. La ayuda que recibe la seora de parte del organismo por su trabajo, le ha sido de mucho beneficio, ya que con lo que percibe paga los estudios universitarios de su hijo, quien se esta preparando para llegar a obtener un puesto laboral en el cual se pueda desarrollar, el esposo de doa Mariana trabaja en Enacal. Estos padres han ido mejorando su condicin de vida, la necesidad mayor de esta familia es la de terminar de construir el porche de su casa, ya que la construccin se encuentra detenida por falta de capital.

loan.use: Purchase of purlins, cement, sand, iron and zinc sheeting

loan.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven M. is 42 years old, married and the father of five children. He makes his living as a farmer and trader. Last year, he started a general store in which he sells produce from his farm as well as a variety of other products. He is requesting a loan of $425 to buy mineral water and other products to sell in his store. In addition to running this business, Steven also leads the Anointing Group, which is made up of 10 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loan.use: To buy mineral water and other products for his store.

loan.name: Lucie Hortense

texts.fr:
Mrs. Lucie P. was born on December 13, 1967 in the economic capital of BENIN. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She is a professional seamstress, and at the same time she sells traditional wrap around fabric (pagnes), dry goods and also phone cards for the different phone networks of BENIN. Her business is set up in the heart of the largest town of BENIN, COTONOU. The customers demand is in a clear-cut growth. The financing not being available, she is requesting a loan to reinforce and improve the conditions of her performance in order to respond to the requests and demands of her clientele that keeps on growing.

Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Ne le 13 dcembre 1967 dans la capitale conomique du BENIN, dame P. Lucie est marie et mre de 3 enfants. Couturire de profession, elle mne paralllement celle-ci la vente des tissus pagne, des produits de mercerie et galement les cartes de recharges des diffrents rseaux de tlphonie du Bnin. Son lieu dactivit tant implant au cur de la plus grande ville du BENIN, COTONOU la demande des clients est en nette progression. Le financement ntant pas au rendez vous elle sollicite ce prt pour renforcer et amliorer les conditions de sa prestation afin de rpondre aux exigences et aux demandes de la clientle qui ne cesse de crotre.

loan.use: Purchase of 2 bales of traditional wrap around fabric and 20 phone cards. Achat de 2 balle de tissus pagne et 20 cartes de recharges.

loan.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Madeleine A. was born in 1968 in COTONOU, she is married and the mother of 6 children. She is a big retailer of smoked shrimps; a product that is quite expensive and is in high demand among the population of BENIN and that of the countries of the West African sub-region. Mrs. Madeleine A., whose activity is booming, is a big supplier of shrimps both inside and outside the country. She is requesting a loan to finance her activity in order to satisfy her customers domestically as well as outside the country, notably the giant neighbor NIGERIA- high consumer of smoked shrimps. Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.
Ne vers 1968 COTONOU, Dame A. Madeleine est marie et mre de 6 enfants. Elle est une grande revendeuse des crevettes fumes; un produit qui cote assez chre et trs recherch par la population du BENIN et celle des pays de la sous rgion ouest africaine. Grande fournisseur des crevettes lintrieur du pays comme lextrieur, Dame A. Madeleine dont l'activit est en plein essor sollicite ce prt pour financer son activit afin de satisfaire la demande tant lintrieur qu lextrieur du pays notamment celle du gant voisin le NIGERIA, grand demandeur de crevettes fumes.

loan.use: Purchase of 10 bowls of fresh shrimps

loan.name: Dios Es Amor, Group 1

texts.en:
Sonia is a 37 year old woman who lives in a small suburb outsiD. of the capital with nine other family members, including her two sons, four daughters and two grandchildren. She runs a small business from her home that sells prepared food. She is asking for this loan so that she can offer more food to her customers and community members, and in turn, make a larger profit.

Her dreams are to be able to better support her family and to see her children continue studying so that they can be smart and educated professionals with healthy and blessed families of their own.

Sonia says that things are often very hard. As her husband has passed away, she has been left to proviD. for everyone, as well as act as both a father and mother. She is very grateful however for the opportunity to take this loan out and sends her thanks and love to all of you who are helping to support her!

loan.use: to purchase larger quantities of food

loan.name: Dios Es Amor, Group 2

texts.en:
Ana is a 53 year old woman who lives on the outskirts of the capital in a suburb called Los Alcarizzos. She lives with her two children, a boy and a girl. She and her husband divorced several years ago and since then she has been left to support the three of them on her own.

Right now she has a small little store that sells earrings, trinkets, beauty supplies and sandals. She is asking for this loan so that she can expand her supply and expand her business. She believes that with better and more inventory, she will be able to sell more and retain her customers.

In the little free time that she can find, Ana Josefa loves to go to her church, watch the local news, and maybe even catch one of the famously dramatic telenovelas that air every night.

From Ana Josefa, and from all of us here at Esperanza, we thank you for your interest and support in helping Ana achieve all of her dreams!

loan.use: to purchase jewelry, personal care products and sandals

loan.name: Adelia

texts.es:
Adelia has an account with the community bank Mujeres Valientes, located in the Jr. Coronel Portillo No. 836, in the Calleria district, in the city of Ucayali. She is 44 years old, is mother to 6 children and she is separated. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/300 she invested the funds into a perfume sales and purchase business.

Today she is still selling perfumes, but she is also in the busines sof sales of clothing and union products (products for a bakery). With the help of her children who share the household chores, in the afternoons she sells her products from door to door.

With the loan of $525, which she will repay in a term of 5 months, she will invest the funds in the purchase of clothing of all sizes, union products, and perfumes in all the price ranges.

Adelia says that working with Manuela Ramos has been a great help for her, for the privileges that are granted to her through the loans and through the union of women in her community bank - thanks to it all everything is turning out very well.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Adelia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N 836, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 aos, es madre de 6 hijos y es separada. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en la compra y venta de perfumes. En la actualidad contina con la venta de perfumes, pero tambin est en el negocio de ropa y productos unin (productos de panadera). Con la ayuda de sus hijos comparte las labores domsticas y en las tardes se dedica a salir a vender sus productos a domicilio. Con el prstamo de S/.1,500, el cual pagar en 5 meses, invertir en la compra de ropa de todas las tallas, productos unin y perfumes de todos los precios. Adelia dice que trabajar con Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para ella, por las facilidades que le brinda es los prstamos y con la unin de compaeras que hay en su banco comunal todo le est yendo muy bien.

loan.use: Compra de ropa, productos unin y perfumes.

loan.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda has an account with the community bank Bellavista, located in Psj. Coronel Bustamante No. 157, in the Calleria district, in the city of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, is mother to three children and her husband works for a natural gas company. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos fo S/300 she invested the funds in to a sales and purchase business of liquors.

Today is a distributor of a wiD. variety of natural liquors maD. from roots, which are more desireable than liquors produced from sugar canes, having a nicer flavour that her customers love.

With the loan of $700, which she will repay in a term of 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of 4 gallons of liquor, and the remaining funds she will invest in the purchase of ingredients such as roots to make her liquors.

Amanda is very happy, always wearing a smile on her face and that is why she has so many clients. She is also known for her charisma and the good customer service she provides them. For Amanda, Manuela Ramos has been a great help in her personal finances.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Amanda pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Psj. Coronel Bustamante N 157, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 45 aos, es madre D. 3 hijos y su esposo trabaja en una empresa D. gas. Con el primer prstamo que recibi D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en la compra y venta D. aguardiente. En la actualidad distribuye gran variedad D. licores naturales a bases D. races, teniendo mas salida el aguardiente D. caa, que es muy agradable y gusta mucho a sus clientes. Con el prstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual pagar en 5 meses, invertir en la compra D. 4 galones D. aguardiente, lo que resta D. capital lo invertir en cortezas y races para que elabore los licores. Amanda es muy alegre, siempre tiene una sonrisa en su cara y por eso tiene muchos clientes, adems por el carisma y la buena atencin que les brinda. Para Amanda Manuela Ramos es una gran ayuda para su economa.

loan.use: To purchase liquors, ingredients - crusts and roots.

loan.name: Dios Es Amor, Group 3

texts.en:
Gloria is a 32 year old woman who lives in a suburb on the outskirts of the capital, Santo Domingo, in the Dominican Republic. She lives with her husband Victor Manuel and her six children (4 boys and 2 girls).

Gloria used to run her own new and used clothing business but ran into hard times a while ago and was unable to continue purchasing merchandise. She is asking for this loan so she can go to an import market and buy a stock of new clothing to restart her business.

This comes at an especially important time in her life, as she and her husband are separating and she needs to have a steady source of income to pay for food and other items around the house.

Gloria and the other four women in her group are grateful to each of you for helping them work towards achieving their dreams. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you as well!

loan.use: to restock her inventory of new clothing

loan.name: Ann

texts.es:
Ann has an account with the community bank Corazon de Jesus, located in the Jr. Carmen Cabrejos No. 762, in the Calleria district, within the city of Ucayali. She is 45 years of age, is mother of 4 children and her husband is a carpenter. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, one of S/ 300, she decided to invest the funds in a tailoring shop.

Today she continues to work in her tailoring shop and she also busy and sells goods, for which she has to travel to Lima to get items at a good price for resale. Once she's done selling the goods she uses those earnigs to purchase fabrics to create bedsheets.

With the loan of $450, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will invest the funds into the purchase of items such as skirts, blouses, slacks, shirts, polo-style shirts, shoes, belts, and fashion jewelery, etc.

Ann feel very happy since she has gained the support of Manuela Ramos. She has become an even more hardworking and entrepreneurial woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Ann pertenece al banco comunal Corazn de Jess, ubicado en el Jr. Carmen Cabrejos N 762, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 aos, es madre de 4 hijos y su esposo es carpintero. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un taller de costura. En la actualidad sigue con el taller de costura y tambin se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadera, para lo cual tiene que viajar a Lima a comprar a un precio cmodo y luego venderlo. Una vez que termina de vender su mercadera utiliza su capital para comprar telas y confeccionar sus prendas y sbanas. Con el prstamo de S/.1,300 el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de mercadera como faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, polos, zapatos, correas, fantasa fina, etc. Ann se siente muy contenta desde que cuenta con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos, se volvi una mujer ms empeosa y emprendedora.

loan.use: to purchase skirts, blouses, and slacks, etc.

loan.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz has an account with the community bank Mujeres Valientes (Brave Women), located in Jr. Coronel Portillo No. 810, in the Calleria district, within the city of Ucayali. She is 70 years old, is a mother of 3 children, and is married to her husband who is now retired. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of S/300 she invested the funds in a small grocery store business.

The small grocery store has grown and so have the sales of cold drinks. Seeing that her children are independent she busies herself only with the grocery store and homemaking.

with the loan of $450, to be repaid in a 5 month term, she will invest in the purchase of 2 boxes of soft drinks, sugar, milk, pastas, breads, and snacks.

Beatriz, regardless of her age, still has the energy to keep working. She a woman to be modelled for her desire to feel valued and because she values herself. Thanks to the guidance given by her community bank, she is succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Beatriz pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N 810, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 70 aos, es madre D. 3 hijos y su esposo es jubilado. Con el primer prstamo que recibi D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en una pequea bodega. En la actualidad la bodega creci y tambin venD. bebidas refrescantes. Como sus hijos ya son independientes slo se dedica a la bodega y a las labores domsticas del hogar. Con el prstamo D. S/.1,300, el cual pagar en 5 meses, invertir en la compra D. 2 cajas D. gaseosas, azcar, leche, fideos, panes y golosinas. Beatriz, a pesar D. su edad, sigue teniendo las energas para seguir trabajando. Es un ejemplo D. mujer a seguir por sus ganas D. sentirse til y valerse por si misma y gracias a los consejos dados en su banco comunal lo est logrando.

loan.use: To purchase soft drinks, sugar, milk, pastas, etc

loan.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia has an account with the community bank Bellavista, located at Jr. Republica of Panama No. 159, in the Calleria district, in the city of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, is mother of 2 children, and her husband is a welder. With her first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/ 300 she decided to invest it in a lawn chair manufacturing business.

In present day she continues to work in her lawn chair manufacturing business. To make lawn chaira she needs a great deal of time and many times her work is extended far beyond a regular day and she exhausts herself, but her children help her with the household chores.

With a loan of $350, which will be repaid in a 5-month term, she will invest in the purchase of cast-iron rods and welding goods to make lawn chairs of all sizes and materials.

Cecilia is a very hardworking woman, and enterpreneurial, and she struggles every day for the sake of her family and to provide the best of rher children, and thanks to Manuela Ramos, she is succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Cecilia pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Republica de Panam N 159, distrito de Callera, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 aos, es madre de 2 hijos y su esposo es soldador. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en el negocio de tejido de mecedoras. En la actualidad sigue con el negocio de tejidos de mecedoras. Elaborar las mecedoras le requiere mucho tiempo y es as que muchas veces su labor se prolonga ms de lo debido y termina cansada, pero con la ayuda de sus hijos realiza las tareas domsticas. Con el prstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagar en 5 meses, invertir en la compra de fierros para elaborar las mecedoras de todos los tamaos, mimbre, sogas para mecedoras y en la soldadura de las mismas. Cecilia es una mujer muy trabajadora, empeosa, que lucha a diario para sacar a su familia adelante y darle lo mejor a sus hijos y gracias a Manuela Ramos lo est logrando.

loan.use: To purchase cast-iron rods and rope materials

loan.name: Libania

texts.es:
Miss Libania belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas," located in Yarinacocha, Ucayali in Peru. She is single, and 22 years old. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S./300 soles, she decided to invest in selling food and drink.

Currently, she runs a restaurant selling typical regional food, which requires her to wake up very early to go to the market.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, oil, condiments, eggs, sugar, sodas, gelatin, and suckers.

Libania says that she gets great support from Manuela Ramos because, "I'm improving the business and more customers are coming to the restaurant all the time. At the same time, they've given me opportunity since I was young to start up my own business."

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seorita Libania pertenece al banco comunal Las Hormiguitas, ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytia Mz. LL Lt. 15, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 aos y es soltera. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comidas y bebidas. En la actualidad cuenta con un restaurante de venta de comidas tpicas de la regin, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado. Con el prstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, aceite, condimentos, huevos, azcar, gaseosas, gelatinas y chupetes. Libania manifiesta que recibe un gran apoyo de Manuela Ramos porque mejoro el negocio y las clientes van cada vez ms seguido al restaurante y a la vez desde joven me dan oportunidades de emprender en un negocio propio.

loan.use: Con el prestamo comprara 1 saco de arroz,aceite y otros productos para su restaurante Purchase 1 sack of rice, oil, and other products for her restaurant.

loan.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Mara belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas," located in Yarinacocha, Ucayali in Peru. She the 36-year-old mother of three children, and her husband is a driver. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S./300 soles, she decided to invest in a small business selling automobile spare parts.

Currently, she relies on that store selling spare parts retail and wholesale. She gets up at 6am to see to her children, prepare the food, and tend her store with the help of her husband.

With this loan for $625, which she will repay in four months, she will invest in buying parts such as tires, belts, filters, brakes, headlights, electronic systems, horns, etc.

Mara is content and grateful because, thanks to the support from Manuel Ramos, she was able to open a business and work independently.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Mara pertenece al banco comunal Las Hormiguitas, ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi Mz. LL Lt. 16, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 aos, es madre de 3 hijos y su esposo es chofer. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un pequeo negocio de venta de repuestos de autos.

En la actualidad cuenta con una tienda donde vende sus repuestos para autos al por mayor y menor. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para atender a sus hijos, preparar la comida y atender su tienda con la ayuda de su esposo.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,800, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de repuestos como llantas, fajas, filtros, frenos, focos, sistemas elctricos, bocinas, etc.

Maria se siente tranquila y agradecida porque gracias al poyo de Manuela Ramos pudo poner un negocio y trabajar de forma independiente.

loan.use: Purchase additional spare parts for her auto parts store.

loan.name: Clara

texts.es:
Mrs. Clara belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Brave Women), located in Callera, Ucayali in Peru. She is a single woman, 37 years old. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S./300 soles, she decided to invest in a manicure business.

Currently, she continues with her manicure business. Her customers have increased thanks to the quality of the service she provides, and they are very satisfied. She is also on top of the latest styles, and always tries to bring the ultimate service, many times requested at the customers' homes.

With this loan for $450, which she will repay in five months, she will invest in different types and colors of nail polishes, pedicure equipment, acrylic nails, cosmetics, and creams.

Ever since she was young, Clara has been fascinated by the art of nail painting, and she never thought she'd make her living in this business. But she is very pleased to be doing what she loves, and this has helped her to become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Clara pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N 836, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 aos y es soltera. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de manicura.

En la actualidad contina con el negocio de manicura, sus clientas han aumentando por la calidad del servicio que presta, t se quedan muy satisfechas, adems esta a la vanguardia de los ltimos modelos, siempre tratando de dar lo ltimo a sus servicios que muchas veces son solicitados a domicilio.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,300, el cual pagar en 5 meses, invertir en la compra de diferentes tipos y colores de esmaltes, aparatos para pedicura, uas acrlicas, cosmticos, cremas.

Clara, desde muy joven, le llamo la atencin de arte de pintar las uas y no pens que ello sera el negocio del cual iba a vivir, pero se siente muy a gusto haciendo lo que mas le gusta y eso la ayud a independizarse.

loan.use: Purchase of nail polish, cosmetics, acrylic nails, etc.

loan.name: Cruz Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Cruz belongs to the community bank "Amistad #2," located in Manantay, Ucayali, in Peru. She is 56 years old, the mother of 4 children, and separated from her spouse. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in a small general store. Now the shop has grown, and she sells other products that she did not sell before. She must get up very early to open the business that she runs with the help of her children, that at the same time carry out various household chores. With this loan for $425, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 case of milk, fideo noodles, and 1 gallon of oil. Cruz is well pleased because Manuela Ramos has given her the opportunity to prove herself without placing obstacles in her way, and her business is growing more all the time.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Cruz pertenece al banco comunal Amistad N 2, ubicado en el AA. HH. Inmaculada Mz. F Lt. 2, distrito de Manatay, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 aos, es madre de 4 hijos y es separada. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en una pequea bodega. En la actualidad la bodega creci y vende otros productos que antes no lo haca. Se tiene que levantar muy temprano para abrir el negocio que atiende con la ayuda de sus hijos, que a la vez se reparten las tareas domsticas. Con este prstamo de S/.1,200 el cual ser pagado en 4 meses, invirti en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azcar, 1 caja de leche, fideos, 1 galn de aceite. Cruz se siente bien satisfecha por que Manuela Ramos le di ola oportunidad de valerse por si misma sin que nadie le ponga obstculos, su negocio esta creciendo cada vez ms.

loan.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc)

loan.name: Meri

texts.es:
Mrs. Meri is part of the community bank Bellavista, which is located at Jr. Calleria N 651, Calleria District, Department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and mother of five children. With the first S/ 300 loan she received from Mauela Ramos, she invested the money to buy food to sell. She is currently selling food as her business. She wakes up very early to purchase groceries from the market, and she dedicates her afternoon preparing the food that she will later sell at night. Her children also help her with her business. With the S/.1,000 loan that she will repay in 5 months, she will buy rice, sugar, chicken meat, fish, pork, vegetables, and other products she uses daily. Although Mrs. Meri is busy everyday, she always saves time to spend with the family because the family is most important to her. She is grateful that Manuela Ramos has provided her with loans for her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Gabrielle Sham.

La seora Meri pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Calleria N 651, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 aos, es madre de 5 hijos y su esposo es obrero. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en la venta de comida. En la actualidad contina con la venta de comida. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar sus vveres, en las tardes se dedica a la preparacin de sus comidas para que en la noche salir a vender. Sus hijos la ayudan. Con el prstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagar en 5 meses, comprar arroz, azcar, carne de pollo, pescado, chancho, verduras, etc, que necesitara para la venta diaria. Meri, a pesar de realizar muchas actividades diarias, siempre se da un tiempo para compartir con su familia porque para ella es muy importante la unin familiar. Gracias a Manuela Ramos que le brinda los prstamos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loan.use: Purchase rice, sugar, chicken meat, and other products

loan.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda belongs to the communal bank "Bellavista," located in Callera, Ucayali in Peru. She is 46 years old, and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a brickmason and a painter. Hilda decided to invest in selling beverages. Currently she runs a small general store. In the morning, she performs her household chores with the help of her children, and in the afternoon, she devotes her attention to her business until 10pm. Then she rests up for her work the next day. With this loan for $700, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase 20 cases of soda, various candies, groceries, and will remodel the business. Hilda is very pleased to belong to the Manuela Ramos family, where she has met some dear friends. She has also shown herself to a punctual businesswoman with her payments for the good of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Hilda pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Manco Cpac N 179, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 aos, es madre de 3 hijos y su esposo es pintor y albail. Hilda decide invertir en la venta de bebidas. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega, en las maanas realiza las tareas domsticas con la ayuda de sus hijos y en las tardes se dedica a la atencin de su negocio hasta las 10 p.m., luego descansa para el trajn del da siguiente. Con el prstamo de S/.2,000, el cual pagar en 5 meses, comprar 20 cajas de gaseosas, golosinas, abarrotes, y remodelar el negocio. Hilda se siente muy feliz de pertenecer a la familia de Manuela Ramos, ah conoci grandes amigas y tambin manifiesta que es una socia puntual con sus pagos para el bien de su banco comunal.

loan.use: Compra de gaseosas, golosinas y abarrotes Purchase of soda, candies, and groceries.

loan.name: Juana Esther

texts.es:
Miss Juana belongs to the communal bank "Las Hormiguitas," located in Yarinacocha, Ucayali in Peru. She is a 43-year-old single woman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S./300, she decided to invest in selling food and beverages.

Currently, she relies on a restaurant where she sells typical foods of the region. To do this, she gets up very early to go to the market and buy supplies that she needs for preparing her meals. She spends the afternoons working in the restaurant.

With this loan for $425, which she will repay in four months, she will make the first payment towards a motorized cycle as well as buy a sack of rice, oil, condiments and eggs.

Juana is very grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos provides her. It has helped her a lot in achieving her various goals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La seorita Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Hormiguitas, ubicado en el Jr. Roberto Ruiz Vargas Mz. P Lt. 32, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 aos y es soltera. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en la venta de comidas y bebidas. En la actualidad cuenta con un restaurante de venta de comidas tpicas de la regin, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los vveres que le harn falta para la preparacin de sus comidas y en las tardes atiende su restaurante. Con el prstamo de S/.1,200, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la inicial para la compra de un motocarro y en 1 saco de arroz, aceite, condimentos y huevos. Juana se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda, le ayuda bastante a lograr varios objetivos.

loan.use: For the down payment on a three-wheeled motorbike, and the purchase of foodstuffs

loan.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Seora Mnica is a member of the communal Corazn de Jess ("Heart of Jesus"), located at Jr. Las Palmas Mz C Lt. 13 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 25 years old, has two kids, and her husband is a businessman. With the first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling boards of bolaina (a lightweight type of wood).

Presently she is dedicated to buying this wood in bulk and selling it in smaller quantities. Mnica has to go very early to the sawmill to cut the wood, and afterwards she brings it home to sell to her clients.

With the loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will invest in purchasing a large quantity of bolaina logs to increase her sales since the demand for her business has increased.

Mnica says that the business is going very well for her. It is growing and with the income obtained she plans to invest in a business of buying and selling plastics and aluminum sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La seora Mnica pertenece al banco comunal Corazn de Jess, ubicado en el Jr. Las Palmas Mz. C Lt. 13, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 aos, dos hijos y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la venta de tablas de bolaina.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de bolaina al por mayor y menor, Mnica tiene que ir muy temprano a los aserraderos para cortar la madera, luego la lleva a su casa para venderlas a sus clientes.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de trozas de bolaina para poder aumentar sus ventas ya que la demanda de su negocio esta aumentando.

Mnica manifiesta que le esta yendo muy bien en el negocio, que est creciendo y con los ingresos obtenidos piensa invertirlos en el negocio de compra y venta de plsticos y fierro de aluminio.

loan.use: bolaina logs

loan.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Seora Nelida is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women), located at Jr Coronel Portillo No. 836 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 34 years old, has a daughter, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business of buying and selling telephone cards.

Presently she has a table that she uses to sell sweets, and at the same time she still sells her phone cards and is overseeing the installation of a business of internet booths. Together with her only daughter they share the household chores and the work for the sweets table.

With the loan of 2000 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest in the construction of internet booths and purchasing telephone cards.

Nelida is a very hardworking woman. With her earnings from selling sweets and with the loans from Manuela Ramos, she was able to save enough to be able to install the internet booths. It was a dream that she's had in her mind for a long time and finally it is being realized through much effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La seora Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N 836, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 aos, una hija y es separada. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de tarjetas telefnicas.

En la actualidad tiene un tablero de venta de golosinas y a la vez vende sus tarjetas y est viendo la implementacin y acondicionamiento de un local para cabinas de internet. Junto con su nica hija de distribuyen las labores domsticas y la atencin de su tablero.

Con el prstamo de S/.2,000, el cual pagar en 5 meses, invertir en la construccin de cabinas de Internet y en la compra de tarjetas telefnicas.

Nelida es una mujer muy trabajadora. Con las ganancias obtenidas de su venta de golosinas y con los prstamos de Manuela Ramos pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para poder poner las cabinas de internet. Era un sueo que desde mucho tenia en mente y que por fin lo est realizando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacin.

loan.use: Construction of internet booths

loan.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Seora Nelly is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women) located at Jr La Habana Mz G Lt. 6 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 68 years old, has nine children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business of buying and selling clothes.

Presently she continues selling second-hand clothing and with the earnings that she has obtained, she bought a motorcart that is driven by her son. In her business, she has to travel constantly to the residents living on the banks of the Ucayali river. With the help of her kids, she gets the physical labor done and they also help her at home.

With the loan of 1200 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest in second-hand clothes, sandals, shoes, and beauty accessories.

Nelly, despite her age and being in a little bit of bad health, continues working because she says that she has some energy and that it makes her feel more alive. It gives her a lot of pleasure and satisfaction to make the trips for her business, because she knows many places and people.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La seora Nelly pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. La Habana Mz. G Lt. 6, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 68 aos, 9 hijos y es separada. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de ropa.

En la actualidad sigue vendiendo ropa de segunda y con las ganancias obtenidas compr un motocarro, que es manejado por su hijo, por cosas de su negocio tiene que viajar constantemente a los caseros del las riberas del ri Ucayali. Con la ayuda de sus hijos realiza esa faena y tambin la ayudan en la casa.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,200, el cual pagar en 5 meses, invertir en la compra de ropa de segunda mano, sandalias, zapatos y accesorios de belleza.

Nelly, a pesar de su edad y estando un poco mal de salud, contina trabajando por que dice que tiene energas para rato y eso la hace sentirse mas viva. Le da mucho placer y satisfacciones los viajes que realiza porque conoce mas lugares y personas.

loan.use: second-hand clothes and other products

loan.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Seora Rayda is a member of the communal bank Bellavista, located at Psj. Coronel Bustamante N 134 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 50 years old, a mother of four kids, and her husband is a welder. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a little grocery store.

Presently the grocery store has grown because she increased the number of products that she sells. With the help of her kids, she runs the grocery store. She has to alternate and lend some of her attention to cooking for her kids and her husband who always comes home for lunch.

With the loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will buy a box of milk, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of oil, sweets, canned goods, sodas, etc.

Rayda is very proud of all that she has achieved. She feels she is a more independent woman now and capable of achieving many things.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La seora Rayda pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Psj. Coronel Bustamante N 134, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 aos, es madre de 4 hijos y su esposo es soldador. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un pequea bodega.

En la actualidad la bodega ha crecido porque aument ms productos que antes no venda. Con la ayuda de sus hijos atiende la bodega y se turnan para la atencin porque Rayda tiene que cocinar para ellos y para su esposo que siempre viene a almorzar.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,500, el cual pagar en 5 meses, comprar 1 caja de leche, 1 saco de azcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, golosinas, conservas, gaseosas, etc.

Rayda est muy orgullosa por todo lo que est logrando. Se siente una mujer ms independiente y capaz de realizar muchas cosas.

loan.use: Purchase of a box of milk, a sack of rice, and other products

loan.name: Porfidia

texts.en:
Porfidia is 38 years old. She has two stands in the central market where she sells meet, which is supported by her buying of cattle locally, and she also sells Herbalife products. Her family is comprised of 5 people, her, her husband, and 3 kids 16,12, and 7. Porfidia has more than 17 years of experience in her various activities, for which the competition does not have much impact given that she has a fixed clientele that appreciates her business. Her prices are relative and vary according to the market of supply and demand. She also has a good credit history.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Porfidia tiene 38 aos de edad. Tiene dos puestos en el mercado central de Warnes donde vende carne, paralelamente tambin realiza la comercializacin de ganado vacuno en la zona, por otra parte trabaja con productos de Herbalife. Su familia est compuesta por 5 personas, ella su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 12, y 7 aos respectivamente. Porfidia tiene ms de 17 aos de experiencia en sus variadas actividades, por lo que si bien la competencia es media la misma no le afecta mucho debido a que cuenta con clientela fija que aprecia su trato al cliente. Los precios son relativos que varian de acuerdo al mercado de la oferta y demanda. Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loan.use: Capital for work

loan.name: Rosa Alejandrina

texts.es:
Seora Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Valiant Women), located at No. 662 Jr Eduardo D. guila in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 57 years old, has three kids, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, Rosa decided to invest in a shed for raising chickens.

Presently she makes a living by selling "the tree of life" which is best known as "noni" (a bitter citrus fruit eaten for its nutritional value) , but she still sells eggs from her birds and never neglects the care of her chicken shed. She wakes up very early to make breakfast and attend to her shed, and after that she focuses on the chores of her home and goes to rest early for the physical work of the next day.

With this loan of 1200 Soles, which will be paid back in five months, she will invest in purchasing 25 farm chickens, buying a balanced diet for them, and remodeling her shed.

Rosa tells us that taking noni makes her feel more healthy and it gives her lots of energy to work and continue forward despite the inconveniences that never leave her. She is very appreciative of Manuela Ramos for all the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La seora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Eduardo del guila N 662, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 57 aos, tiene 3 hijos, es separada, Rosa con el primer prstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300, deciD. invertir en un galpn D. crianza D. pollos.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta del rbol D. la vida que es mas conocido como noni pero sin descuidar su galpn y venta D. huevos, se levanta muy temprano para hacer el desayuno y atender su galpn, D. ah se dedica al aseo D. su casa y descansa temprano para la faena del da siguiente.

Con este prstamo D. S/.1,200 el cual ser pagado en 5 meses, invirti en la compra D. 25 pollos D. chacra, alimento balanceado y en la remodelacin D. su galpn.

Rosa, nos cuenta que tomando noni se siente muy bien D. salud y eso le da muchas energas para trabajar y seguir adelante a pesar D. los inconvenientes que nunca faltan, est muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por toda la ayuda brindada.

loan.use: 25 farm chickens, a balanced chicken diet, and remodeling her shed

loan.name: Sinfuriana Eumelia

texts.es:
Seora Sinfuriana is a member of the communal bank Corazn de Jess ("Heart of Jesus"), located at Av. Universitaria Mz G Lt 22 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 52 years, has seven children, and her husband is a locksmith. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in raising chickens.

Presently Sinfuriana owns a shed in which she raises diverse types of birds so that later she may sell them in the market and to different restaurants. Sinfuriana works with the support of her kids in order to grow the business so that each day it prospers more than the previous day.

With the loan of 1700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will invest in fixing up the shed, buying a balanced diet for her birds, and purchasing a great quantity of little chicks.

For Sinfuriana working with Manuela Ramos is a great help, especially for all the support and motivation that is offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La seora Sinfuriana pertenece al banco comunal Corazn de Jess, ubicado en la Av. Universitaria Mz G Lt 22, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 aos, 7 hijos y su esposo es cerrajero. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la crianza de pollos.

En la actualidad tiene un galpn en la cual cra diversos tipos de aves, para luego venderlos en el mercado y en los diferentes restaurantes. Sinfuriana cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos para llevar adelante el negocio que prospera cada da ms.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,700, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en el arreglo del galpn, en la compra de comida balanceada para sus aves y en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollitos.

Para Sinfuriana trabajar con Manuela Ramos es un apoyo y una gran ayuda, mas que todo por las charlas que le brindan, le ayudan y le motivan para seguir adelante.

loan.use: The loan will be invested in improving the shed and buying food for her birds.

loan.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.en:
Shely P. is an energetic and lively 28 year old woman with 7 kids (ages 9, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, and 8 months.) She is happily married and loves her kids more than anything else in the world. When she is not working she enjoys reading her Bible. With her first loan funded by Kiva, she was able to begin running her own business selling clothing to other people in her community. With this next loan she hopes to expand her business. Her goal is to have a boutique in Puerto Plata that sells nice clothes and shoes. She would also like to expand her home because there are nine people and not much room!

This Bank of Hope has been part of Esperanzas microfinance program for over a year. Three of the four groups are applying for their second loan and one group is applying for the first time. The group of twenty women is very diverse: some have come over to the DR with their families from Haiti, and others were born and raised here. For these five women, this is an opportunity they have only dreamed of. Because it actually costs money in the Dominican Republic to even save money its unfathomable for these women to think that they would be offered a loan from someone besides a greedy loan shark, much less an organization that anticipates their personal growth and success.

On behalf of Esperanza, Shely, and the entire group we would like express our gratitude for your generosity and support!

loan.use: to purchase new clothing and shoes

loan.name: Maria Eshter

texts.es:
Maria is 40 years old and works at the Warnes monastery. Her husband is employeed by the SOBOLMA company. Maria dedicates herself to the sale of refrigerators and beer on the weekends. Also she finds work transcribing data and information, and other computation work, which she does from home. Her family is comprised of six people, her, her husband, and her four children 19, 18, 16, and 6. Maria has the experience of more than 11 years as much for being a professor as for the work she has. She encounters medium competition, but it is her experience that gives her the edge.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Maria tiene 40 aos de edad y trabaja en el magisterio de Warnes, su esposo es empleado fijo de la empresa SOBOLMA. De manera particular, Mara, se dedica a la venta de refrigerios y cerveza los fines de semana, tambin realiza trabajos de transcripcin de datos y otros trabajos en computacin, mismo que los realiza en su domicilio. Su familia est compuesta por seis personas, ella su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 16 y 6 aos respectivamente. Maria tiene una antiguedad de ms de 11 aos, tanto como profesora como tambin en las otras actividades que realiza. Su competencia en todos los rubros es media, pero su antiguedad es la que marca la diferencia. La solicitud es para la adquisicin de capital de trabajo tanto para la venta de refrigerios como material para sus trabajos de computacin. Los precios de estos artculos varian dependiendo del proveedor. Maria es una persona muy responsable y tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loan.use: Capital for work

loan.name: Carmen Teresa

texts.es:
Carmen is 46 years old and dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics from the Yanbal and Avon lines. Her husband has a little artisan factory of plastics connectors for glass tables. Her family is comprised of her, her husband, and their son. The family lives near the town of Urkupina which is quite far from the city.
