texts.en: Neli M. lives with her husband in the town of Smolian. She works in a garment factory that encourages its employees to do some work at home and thus generate additional payments. Neli wants to be able to work at home but she needs to buy a sewing machine.

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loan.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Born in 1950, Mrs. Akouvi Agathe G. is married and has three children. A seamstress by profession, she runs her business out of a straw hut as her means are too limited to have a workroom worthy of this title. She is requesting a loan to rent a workroom, buy some sewing machines and improve her set-up so that she will have a workplace that is more agreeable to her clientele, which keeps growing. Achieving this project will enable her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1967, Madame G. Akouvi Agathe est marie et mre de trois (3) enfants. Couturire de profession, elle exerce son activit sous une paillote car ses moyens sont trs limits pour avoir un atelier digne de ce nom. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer un atelier, acheter des machines et mieux sinstaller afin de rendre plus agrable son lieu de travail sa clientle qui ne cesse daugmenter. La ralisation de ce projet lui permettra davoir une autonomie financire

loan.use: To rent a workroom and buy a sewing machine

loan.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a craftsman, he makes hats for the Cholitas* and his wife weaves shawls for them.

Together, they also have a groceries store in the area of Villa Ingenio, city of El Alto. These 2 activities generate an income that allows them to support their 4 children (ages 12, 9, 5 and 2).

Antonio would like to use the loan to buy more supplies for his grocery store in order to increase his sales and income. He currently sells basic commodity products like bread, eggs, candies and drinks.

This is the first time he asks for a loan and the credit evaluation of Impro authorizes him to get it.

(*Note from the translator: Cholita is a Bolivian native woman that wears her waist-length hair in braids connected together at the ends with tassled tullmas, a traditional multilayered skirt (called pollera), a wide shawl (called manta) that accompanies the skirt and a small felt bowler hat balanced on top of her head. For an image you can check: http://www.lubbockonline.com/images/20070815/82730_512.jpg)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Description Antonio es artesano; l confecciona sombreros para cholitas y la esposa teje mantas de cholitas; tambin tienen una tienda de abarrotes. Estas dos actividades generan sus ingresos econmicos para cubrir la manutencin de sus cuatro hijos de 12, 9, 5 y 2 aos de edad; viven en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crdito que Antonio requiere en esta oportunidad ser utilizado para comprar mercadera para la tienda de abarrotes de esa forma incrementara sus ingresos familiares. Una tienda de abarrotes es una tienda de barrio donde los vecinos encuentran pan, refrescos, huevos, jugos, dulces, y otros productos bsicos de la canasta familiar.

Es el primer crdito con Impro y la evaluacin realizada le faculta para acceder al mismo. .

loan.use: To buy more supplies for his grocery store

loan.name: Rhinatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rhinatou A. was born in 1971, is married and has seven children. Her main activity is selling bean fritters and millet porridge, commonly known as coco and very popular here, especially for breakfast and as an afternoon snack. Lacking sufficient means, she is requesting a loan that she can use to buy cans of oil and bags of beans, millet and sugar in order to better satisfy her customers. This will enable her to increase her income for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Rhinatou est ne en 1971, marie et mre de sept (7) enfants. Son activit principale est la vente de beignets de haricot et de bouillie de mil communment appele coco et trs apprcis chez nous surtout pour le petit djeuner et le goter. Nayant pas de moyens suffisants, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira dacheter des sacs de haricot, de mil, de sucre et de bidons dhuile pour mieux satisfaire sa clientle. Ceci lui permettra daccrotre ses revenus pour le mieux tre de sa famille.

loan.use: To obtain supplies of millet and beans

loan.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta sells food in a food stand in the area of San Pedro in the City of La Paz. Her husband is a craftsman and makes shoes. That is how together they generate the necessary income to cover their family expenses, including the school expenses of their 2 children.

Antonieta and her family live in the area of Las Nieves in the City of La Paz.

Antonieta requests the loan to buy wholesale potatoes, rice and noodles. These are the main ingredients she uses to cook and their price has increased due to the Nia phenomenon* that has affected Bolivia.

This is the 5th loan Antonieta has requested from Impro and her credit history allows her to get it. All her prior loans have been completely paid.

(*Note from the translator: La Nia phenomenon is blamed for fueling torrential rains and massive flooding across Bolivia's Amazon region during recent months)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonieta es vivandera; tiene un puesto de venta de comida en la zona San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. El esposo es artesano y confecciona calzados y de esta manera logran sus ingresos con los que cubre los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Las Nieves de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crdito requerido ser utilizado para capital de trabajo y comprar papa, arroz y fideo por cantidad para poder abastecerse porque estos productos son su materia prima y estn subiendo de precio por el fenmeno de la nia que castigo a Bolivia.

Es el quinto crdito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle otro prstamo. Los cuatro crditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loan.use: To buy wholesale potatoes, rice and noodles

loan.name: Muradkhan

texts.en:
Muradkhan is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Aghdam. He owns an appliance repair shop. Most of his business comes from buying used refrigerators and reselling them.

Muradkhan has been in this business for five years. During this time, he has learned that used refrigerators are cheaper in the winter time. He is asking for this loan so that he can purchase some old, cheap refrigerators now and resell them in the summer for a large profit.

His uncle, who is fixing a washing machine in the photo, is a partner in business. Muradkhan is single.

loan.use: To buy refrigerators to repair and resell.

loan.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao A. was born in Gap (Zio prefecture) in 1975. Coming from a very poor family, he did not have the opportunity to go to school. He is married and the father of two children. In addition to agriculture, he runs a little farm of small ruminants and poultry. He thus does not have the means to build a sheep pen, obtain water troughs, mangers and the like. He is requesting financial support in the form of a loan. Achieving this project will help him and his family truly flourish.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Yao est n Gap (P/Zio) en 1975. Issu dune famille trs pauvre, il navait pas eu la chance dtudier. Mari, il est le pre de deux (2) enfants. En plus de lagriculture, il entretien un petit levage de petits ruminants et de volailles. Ainsi, ses moyens ne lui permettent pas de faire face aux besoins de construction de paillote de bergerie, de se doter des abreuvoirs, mangeoires et divers. Il sollicite un appui financier sous forme de crdit. La ralisation de ce projet contribuera son plein panouissement et celui de sa famille.

loan.use: To build and fit out a sheep pen

loan.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona is a traveling saleswoman who sells spices (garlic, oregano, whole chiles, etc.) from province to province. Her husband provides DJ services at social events. These two activities make up their main sources of income with which they support their three children. Their home is located in the Villa Esperanza zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan Simona is requesting will be used to buy equipment for the DJ business, specifically a sound mixer which will help improve performance so they can offer better service to their customers.

This is her fourth loan with IMPRO; her prior record allows her to be approved for this request. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and has paid off her previous loans without any problem.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglsi, Kiva volunteer.

Simona es comerciante viajera interprovincial de condimentos (ajo, organo, aj entero, etc.) el esposo presta servicio de amplificacin y ameniza todo tipo de eventos sociales. Estas dos actividades constituyen sus principales fuentes de ingresos con los que cubren la manutencin de sus tres hijos que dependen de ellos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Esperanza de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crdito que Simona solicita ser utilizado para compra de equipo para el servicio de amplificacin, especficamente una mezcladora de sonido, la misma que ayudara para el mejor rendimiento de la amplificacin y as ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Es el cuarto crdito con IMPRO, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por la prestataria. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el ao 2005 y ha cancelados sus previos prstamos sin ninguna dificultad.

loan.use: Purchase equipment for her husband's DJ business.

loan.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Born in May 1970, Mrs. Eya G. has been selling condiments and basic need goods since childhood. She is the mother of four (4) children, all of whom have been in her care after her husband abandoned the family. Disciplined in the management of her business, she was able to repay her previous loan. She is asking for a new loan in order to enlarge her store display and to stock up on food products in order to better serve her clientele. This will allow her to fulfill all her responsibilities with respect to her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en Mai 1970, Madame G. Eya est revendeuse des condiments et de produits de premires ncessits depuis son enfance. Mre de quatre (4) enfants, qui sont tous sa charge aprs labandon du foyer conjugal par leur pre. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activit, elle a su bien rembourser son crdit antrieur. Elle sollicite de nouveau un crdit en vue dagrandir son talage et sapprovisionner en produit alimentaire afin de mieux servir sa clientle. Ceci lui permettra dassurer toute sa responsabilit envers ses enfants

loan.use: To stock up on merchandise

loan.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.en:
This group of dedicated women entrepreneurs goes by the name of Maria Auxilidora and operates out of the town of Ita. They were started in the month of August 2006 by the president of the club, Maria Ana A.. She began by contacting her neighbors and friends with the idea of coming together and working with Fundacin Paraguaya to obtain a loan.

Together these women work, meet weekly, and support each other in their businesses. There is a strong bond between the women in the group both in business and in friendship. The solidarity of their group is what makes them great candidates for a loan. The money of the loan will go towards buying more goods to be sold in their individual businesses. Each woman will receive the appropriate amount needed for her business and together they will work to pay back the loan.

loan.use: to invest in merchandise for their businesses

loan.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amina A. was born in January 1973 in Gap (Prefecture Zio), and has been selling smoked fish since she abandoned her studies in 1983. The mother of four (4) children, she takes care of her children by herself, thanks to the income from her business selling smoked fish. Mrs. A. struggles to run her business and make her children happy. She is asking for a loan in order to increase her buying power and to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Amina ne en Janvier 1973 Gap (P/Zio), est revendeuse de poissons fums depuis quelle a abandonne les classes en 1983. Mre de quatre (4) enfants, elle est seule soccuper des enfants grce aux revenus de son commerce de poissons fums. Madame A. se bat pour mettre en uvre son activit et rendre heureux ses enfants. Elle sollicite un financement pour augmenter son pouvoir dachat et mieux satisfaire sa clientle.

loan.use: To sell fish

loan.name: Atilana

texts.en:
Amilana is a 71-year-old mother of four. All of her children are grown and live in Argentina. For thirty-eight years she has worked as a distributor of charcoal. She and her husband both sell it, in their convenience store which is connected to their house and using their truck.

With the price of gasoline going up, many people depend on their supply of charcoal to help them prepare meals. The loan that she is asking for today is to invest in more charcoal to sell. The demand for her product has been going up and with the coming winter season, she is expecting charcoal sales to continue to increase.

loan.use: to buy charcoal for re-sale

loan.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in 1968 in Gap, where he now works as a farmer. A married father of two (2), he also has three (3) of his brother's children as apprentices. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. He owns a large field of pineapples, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou cultivateur Gap est n en 1968 dans la mme localit. Mari et pre de deux (2) enfants il a en charge trois (3) autres enfants de son frre en apprentissage. Son activit principale est lagriculture qui lui procure le ncessaire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il dispose dun vaste champ dananas mais cause de la pauvret du sol et des insectes il narrive plus satisfaire la demande du march. Trs travailleur, il sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et des insecticides

loan.use: To buy fertilizer

loan.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio and Eulalia are married with four older children. Three of them are independent and one still lives at home. Together the two have a farm which they work on, and they sell the food that they cultivate. With the money they made from selling their simple fruits and vegetables, the pair was able to invest in a truck in which to transport their goods door-to-door.

Now the couple is looking to expand their business even more and have a larger variety of fruits and vegetables than what they grow and sell. The loan they are asking for will be used for that purpose, to help them increase their sales and thus their income.

loan.use: To buy various fruits and vegetables for re-sale

loan.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
At 42 years of age, Mrs. Akouvi A. is married and has five (5) children. Abandoned by her husband, she turned to agriculture to support her family. She is very happy with her work, and wants to see her children educated at any cost. To improve the yield of her farming, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the soil in order to increase production. This will allow her to raise her income and improve the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Age de 42 ans, Madame A. Akouvi est marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants. Abandonn par son mari, elle sadonne lagriculture pour satisfaire sa famille. Elle est trs contente de son activit et veut tout prix voir ses enfants scolariss et instruits. Pour amliorer le rendement de son activit agricole, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants pour ses terres en vue dune bonne production. Ceci lui permettra daugmenter ses revenus pour le mieux tre de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer

loan.name: Fanni

texts.en:
Fanni is a hairdresser and a mother of two. Her husband is in the business of repairing computers. She has been in the business of hairstyling for 15 years now and it is her passion.

Seven years ago, after a lot of hard work and savings, she was able to become independent from the business where she worked, and now has her own salon in a rented venue. She dreams of one day owning her own salon.

For now she is increasing the diversity of merchandise her salon. She has invested in clothing to be sold in her shop to bring in more income. Fanni is asking for a loan today to invest in more supplies for her salon. She will buy goods like shampoo, hair dye, and various hair creams.

loan.use: To buy shampoo, hair creams, and dyes

loan.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a hard-working mother of four. She runs a small grocery store out of her house where she sells general necessities. Her husband is a potter who makes various decorative goods out of clay.

For seven years now she has run her grocery store and it has continued to increase in business and income. Gracielas next goal is to save enough money from her work, along with her husbands work, to construct a second story on their house.

She is asking for a loan today to help her flourishing business. Her plan is to buy rice, sugar, flour, general drinks and baked goods for her shop. With the increase in goods she will be better able to meet the demands of her customers.

loan.use: To buy flour, sugar, baked goods and drinks for re-sale

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a carpenter. He has worked 15 years in the business and has worked hard to save enough money to buy the house where he lives now. Currently, he has the necessary materials he needs to make furniture, windows, and doors.

The only thing that he lacks which would make his business prosper is a truck to transport his goods. With the investment in a truck, he will be able to expand his area for attracting customers and facilitate his business by delivering the furniture he makes.

However, he is taking small steps first and will use the money that he is asking for to buy the necessary amount of wood needed to continue making his furniture. After a little time, Juan Carlos feels sure that he will be able to obtain the truck that will help his business grow.

loan.use: to buy wood for building furniture

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a proud mother of six children all of whom live on their own, independent from their mother and father. At the moment, Marcelina is dedicated to the making and sale of cigars. She learned this skill when she was very young since her entire family is dedicated to the same business.

She sells her products throughout the country in different locations and there is a great demand for her product. With the loan that she is asking for today, Marcelina will purchase more tobacco in bulk which will allow her to sell her goods at a lower price.

loan.use: to buy tobacco to hand-make cigars

loan.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata K. is very grateful to Kiva. The last loan obtained from Kiva increased her stock of fish and she is happy that she no longer purchases fish on credit. The loan helped her build her capital. Aminata said that one of her children was sick when her husband was away. Because of the loan, she was able to make enough profit and pay for the medical bills herself. She is thankful to Kiva and has completed her repayments. She is requesting another loan of Le.800, 000.

loan.use: Aminata is so proud of her accomplishments from her previous Kiva loan and would like to continue experiencing the positive change the additional capital provides.

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Being a young member of the 15th branch, Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 33 years old, is very good at doing business. Realizing that TYM Fund policy was very suitable for her family conditions, from the beginning, she borrowed 60 USD to breed pigs. By using husks wasted from the husking machine as pig mash, her breeding plan became more effective and expanded. Currently, she has 18 pigs (about 1000 kg) ready to be released with an intended profit of 2000 USD. Besides, she is investing in making ice-cream machines, and general store, etc. Therefore, her family income is very stable. Her wish is to borrow more money to expand her breeding plan and other businesses, increasing family income. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy pig mash and unhusked rice. Mrs T. is living with her husband and 2 children in Yen Lac, Vinh Phuc.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

L mt trong nhng thnh vin tr ca chi nhnh 15 nhng ch Nguyn Th T., 33 tui, l ngi lm kinh t gii. Nhn thc c li ch ca Qu Tnh thng l rt ph hp vi iu kin gia nh nn ngay t nhng ngy u ch T. vay 60USD u t chn nui ln. Tn dng cm b t vic lm my xay xt, nu ru lm thc n chn nui nn d n chn nui ln ngy cng mang li hiu qu v c u t ln hn. Hin ti ch c 18 con ln tht (khong hn 1 tn) sp cho xut chung d tnh thu khong 2000USD. Ngoi ra ch cn u t vo m ca hng lm my kem, bn hng ... nn thu nhp ca gia nh rt tt v n nh. Mong mun ca ch T. l c vay nhng mc vn ln hn m rng d n chn nui - kinh doanh tng thu nhp cho gia nh. Vng vn ny ch xin vay 950USD mua thc n gia sc vo go v xay xt. Ch T. hin ang sng cng chng v hai con ti Yn Lc, Vnh Phc.

loan.use: Buy food for pigs and unhusked rice

loan.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is the proud mother of three grown children who are living independently and are successful. She has been married to her husband Jacinto for many years and together they have made their living raising chickens.

Six years ago they increased their business and were able to give employment to two other people in the community as well. Over the years they have formed a great clientele and are known for the excellent quality of their chickens.

Now they have expanded their business and also run a general store where they sell the chickens along with other food. Their small convenience store is also successful, however, Irene is looking to expand. She wants to use the meat that they raise to make Paraguayan delicacies to sell as snacks in their shop. With the loan, Irene will buy the necessary ingredients to make the food to sell.

loan.use: buying ingredients to make empanada and milonesas, along with general refreshments

loan.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata C. sells fish. With her previous loan from Kiva, she increased her stock. She is very grateful that her profit has increased. She said that the most important difference that the loan has made on her business is her ability to purchase the stock in cash. After the second loan, she will be able to build sufficient capital for her business. She said, The Kiva loan saved me from the bondage of debts to suppliers without benefit. Fatmata is requesting for another loan of Le.1, 000,000.

loan.use: Fatmata is enjoying the new financial freedom she has with her business and wants to further expand her stock of fish to ensure her profits continue to grow..

loan.name: Gulbeniz

texts.en: Gulbeniz S. is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Fizuli. She is married and has five children. During Soviet times, she worked in a textile workshop making sheets. She lost her job when she became an IDP. This is when she started buying wholesale fabric and selling it door to door. Now she buys both finished and unfinished fabric. She sews the unfinished fabric into bed sheets in order to make a greater profit. Gulbeniz has an IDP neighbor that she would like to hire for her business. She will use this loan to buy inventory for this new employee to sell.

loan.use: Purchase of new inventory for her fabric store

loan.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi D., 52 years old, is an exemplary member of the branch. She was one among the first 5 members of TYM Fund in the area. She also encouraged other people to join the Fund. Her early plan was to invest in breeding pigs and work on rice field. However, since there was policy allowing people to exchange the rice field for other-purpose land, she bravely invested money and effort in transforming the land into the fish ponds and orchards. Her family income from the fish ponds in 2007 was approximately 3000 USD. Currently, her family is working on 3 rice fields, 4 fish ponds. Therefore, she is very busy at this time. However, she still manages to find some spare time to join activities of the area. She is elected to be the head of her living area. Her husband is very sympathetic with her work and is a great help to her. Her business plan is going very well; therefore, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more fishes and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Ch ng Th D., 52 tui, l mt thnh vin gng mu ca cm. Ngay t nhng ngy u khi Qu v, ch l mt trong 5 thnh vin u tin, ngoi ra ch cn tch cc vn ng nhiu thnh vin khc cng tham gia. D n ban u ch u t vo chn nui ln v lm rung nhng t khi hp tc x c chnh sch dn in i tha, gia nh ch mnh dn u t tin ca, cng sc ci to rung o ao th c kt hp trng cy n qu. Thu nhp t c nm 2007 va qua khong 3000USD. Hin ti gia nh cy 3 mu la, gn 4 mu ao th c, hng ngy ch tp trung ton b thi gian vo cng vic nn rt tt bt. Mc d vy ch vn dnh thi gian cho vic i sinh hot v cc cng vic chung ca cm c ch em tn nhim bu lm cm trng. Chng ch rt hiu v to mi iu kin ch hon thnh cng vic chung. D n ang trn pht trin nn ch D. tip tc xin vay 950USD mua c ging v thc n.

loan.use: Buy fishes and food for them

loan.name: Adama

texts.en: God bless the initiators of this wonderful program, exclaimed Adama. "The loan has improved my family livelihood. She proudly said she was able to send one of her sons to college and has paid all the tuition fees and this is purely from the profit. She added that she would very grateful if Kiva could grant her more loan capital to expand her business. She sells various food items in the market, and there is a lot of demand. She is requesting for Le.800, 000. Adama has completed paying her previous loan.

loan.use: Adama needs an additional loan for expansion of her business so she can continue paying for her son's college tuition fees.

loan.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
When the TYM Fund came to Thanh Lm village in May, 2000, Mrs. Hong Th Tt, 49 years old, checked out the organization then decided to join. At that time, the familys economy was in deep hardship. Her oldest son just got a construction job, and there was nothing else besides farming a little patch of rent rice paddy. For dwelling, they got a modest [i]three section[/i] hut. She took out loan to invest in her new business, trading vegetable and grain. With her income, income from her sons construction job and together with a loan from her relatives, she is building their first house which costs 10,000USD. This time she is applying a loan of 950USD to buy more grain. The monthly familys income is 22-USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Thng 5 nm 2000, khi Qu Tnh thng v x Thanh Lm, sau khi tm hiu, ch Hong Th Tt, 49 tui, l mt trong nhng thnh vin ng k tham gia. iu kin gia nh ch lc y thuc din kh khn, con trai ln mi i lm, ngoi vi so rung khon ra ch cng khng bit lm g thm. Ngi nh 3 gian tm b, tunh tong trnh ma nng rt kh cc. Sau khi tham gia vay vn, ch Tt lun s dng ng mc ch v c hiu qu, con trai ln i xy dng cng c thc tit kim cho gia nh. Ngoi ra ch cng c thm ngh ph l hng ngy thu mua rau ng bao t t hng cho khch hng H ni. Sau by nm tham gia Qu vi s t tin, cn c, chu kh, ch Tt tch ly c mt s vn. Cng vi vn vay h hng, ch ang xy dng cn nh mi rt khang trang tr gi hn 10000USD. Khi chng ti n hai v chng ch nim n tip chng ti v khng giu c nim vui mng khi ngi nh m c ca anh ch ang c ct ln. Tm s ca anh ch l tip tc gn b vi Qu xy dng cuc sng gia nh ngy cng m no, tt p hn. Vng vn ti ch Tt xin vay 950USD thu mua rau ng bao t. Thu nhp hng thng ca gia nh l 220USD.

loan.use: Buy grain

loan.name: Precila

texts.es:
Mrs. Precila A. R. belongs to the Communal Bank Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian. She sells candy and also makes and sells sweaters. She sells her products from her home and on the corner of the main plaza in Chiquian, in Bolognesi province, Ancash state.

With a previous loan of S/1500 nuevos soles (unit of money in Peru), she has grown her business and income. With this loan of S/1500 nuevos soles which will be repaid in 8 months, she will invest in buying candy and yarn to knit sweaters.

She is 38 years old, has 5 children, and her income allows her to educate her children and support the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Precila A. R. pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor de los Milagros de Chiquian ,se dedica a la venta de golosinas y tambin a la confeccin y venta de chompas Sus productos los vende es su domicilio y las golosinas en la esquina de la plaza de armas del distrito de Chiquian, Provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crdito anterior de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su negocio y sus ingresos. Con este prstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 8 meses, lo invertir en comprar golosinas e hilos para tejer las chompas.

Ella tiene e 38 aos de edad, conviviente tiene 5 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos y apoyar en los gastos del hogar.

loan.use: Buy candy and yarn

loan.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hong Th Gii, 38 years old, lives with her husband and two school age children in M Linh, Vnh Phc. When the agricultural expansion plan introduced to all provinces, Mrs. Gii has soon realized that that was a very rare opportunity. While other families might use their monies to build houses, she wisely used her money to invest in her farm. The investment brings her a handsome income. Currently she has a nice half acre farm which produces vegetable for the Hanois markets. The product impresses the Office of Agricultural Encouragement of the Department of Agriculture and the office endorses it as an agricultural model for the province. Recently she invested 1,500USD to purchase 500 grapefruit trees for her current project. This time she is applying for a loan of 950USD to purchase more fruit trees and fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Hong Th Gii, 38 tui, sng cng chng v 2 con ang trong tui i hc ti M Linh, Vnh Phc. Khi vic xy khu cng nghip pht trin ti cc tnh, ch Gii sm nm bt c iu kin v c hi ca gia nh m khng phi ai cng c th lm c. Trong khi nhiu gia nh dng tin n b xy dng nh ca, mua sm tin nghi, th ch Gii v chng dng ng tin vo vic ci to rung t, dn in i tha thnh khu tp trung trng trt cc loi rau sch cung cp cho th trng. S tin u t vo d n cng kh ln v ang cho thu nhp cao. Hin ti ch Gii c 7 so vn trng cc loi rau cung cp cho th trng H Ni v cc vng khc. Sn phm ca gia nh ch c Phng khuyn nng, s nng nghip chn lm d n in hnh v nhn rng ra ton tnh. Mi y ch Gii cn u t 1500USD u t mua 500 cy bi Din trng quy hoch theo m hnh trang tri, d kin sau vi ba nm sau s cho thu nhp. D n ln, dm ngh, dm lm v rt nng ng l cm nhn ca ngi vit bi khi n thm m hnh ca ch. Tng lai cn ang pha trc vn cn khng t nhng kh khn, vt v nhng ch Gii lun tin tng vo s thnh cng ca d n. Vng vn ny ch xin vay 950USD mua cy ging v phn bn.

loan.use: Buy fruit trees and fertilizer

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Finish building two rooms to be rented.

loan.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
Roger lives with his family in the La Fuente neighborhood. Since he was very young he has worked in metal shops, where he acquired enough experience to become independent and start up his own business. He has had his business for more than 10 years and has a good number of clients he does work for. He is an expert in making iron gates and doors as well as glass windows and sliding doors among other things.

His work has allowed him to grow in his chosen field, acquiring good tools and work utensils. Together with his wife they are raising their three children, all of them minors and students in primary school. His wife helps him with household expenses; she sells food and natural soft drinks from home. In this way they have been able to improve their familys standard of living. For the type of work which Roger does he needs an electric soldering machine, which will be of great use to give a better finish to the products he makes.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El seor Roger habita con su familia en el barrio La Fuente, desde muy joven trabaj en talleres metalrgicos, en donde adquiri suficiente experiencia que le sirvi para independizarse y montar su propio negocio, el cual ya tiene ms de 10 aos de tenerlo, posee un buen numero de clientes a quienes le trabaja, es un experto en elaborar verjas y portones de hierro, as como tambin ventanas de vidrio y puertas corredizas, entre otras cosas.

Su trabajo le ha permitido crecer en el ramo al cual se dedica, adquiriendo buenas herramientas y utensilios de trabajo. Junto a su esposa han sacado adelante a sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad, estudiantes de primaria. Su esposa le apoya con los gastos de la casa, la seora vende en su vivienda comida y refrescos naturales. De esta forma han logrado mejorar la condicin de vida de su familia. Para el tipo de trabajo que realiza Roger necesita de una maquina soldadora elctrica, la cual es de mucha utilidad para darle un mejor acabado al producto que realiza.

loan.use: Purchase an electric soldering machine.

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyn Th t, 38 years old, lives with husband and two children in M Linh, Vnh Phc. Same as other farmers in the area, life is harder when most of the farm land now converted to industrial plants. Seeing an opportunity in maize, she converted her little patch of rice daddy to a corn field. Besides her familys production, she buys more maize from other family and delivers all to markets in Hanoi. In result, she has a little reputable business of trading maize. Though busy she still spends times with activities in the TYM Fund. This time she is applying a loan of 950USD to stock more maize. The average monthly income is 200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Nguyn Th t, 38 tui, sng cng chng v 2 con ti M Linh, Vnh Phc. Cng nh nhiu gia nh khc trong cm, khi rung nng ngy cng t i nhng ch cho cc nh my, x nghip th cng kh khn cho ch v cc gia nh lm nng nghip khc. Thy th trng ang c nhu cu rau ng bao t, ch t chuyn ton b s t nng nghip cn li sang trng rau ng bao t. Ngoi vic sn phm ca gia nh, ch t cn thu mua thm ca cc gia nh khc v tiu th th trng H ni. Gi y gia nh ch tr thnh im thu mua, tiu th kh ln v rt c uy tn. Cng vic nhiu, chy ch sut ngy nhng ch t vn dnh thi gian tham gia y vo cc bui hp v cc hot ng chung ca Qu Tnh thng. Vng vn ti ch t tip tc vay 950USD thu mua rau ng bao t ca cc gia nh trong vng. Thu nhp bnh qun ca gia nh ch t l 200USD.

loan.use: Buy small maize

loan.name: Primitiva Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. Primitiva Beatriz R. P. belons to the Communal Bank Seor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian. She sells alfajores, a caramel sandwich cookie, in different stores in the Chiquian area, Bolognesi province, Ancash state. She also sends orders of 500 alfajores to Lima.

With a previous loan of S/800 soles she has been able to grow her business and her income. With the current loan of S/1200 soles which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy flour, butter, sugar, and milk at wholesale prices.

She is 49 years old, a single mother of 4 children, and her income enables her to educate her children and pay her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Primitiva Beatriz R. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal Seor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, ella se dedica a la venta D. alfajores los cuales son repartidos en las diferentes tiendas del distrito D. Chiquian, provincia D. Bolognesi, departamento D. Ancash. Tambin enva pedidos D. 500 alfajores a la ciudad D. Lima.

Con el crdito anterior S/. 800.00 nuevos soles ha podido incrementado su negocio y sus ingresos. Con el prstamo D. S/. 1,200.00 el cual ser cancelado en 8 meses lo invertir en la compra D. harina, manteca, azcar y leche por mayor.

Ella tiene 49 aos, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos y solventar los gastos del su hogar.

loan.use: Purchase flour, butter, sugar and milk

loan.name: Cruz Luciano

texts.es:
Cruz Luciano is 34 years old, married, and has one 4-year old child. He lives in Villa Reconciliacin, a poor, semirural area with unpaved streets. 10 years ago he began a business selling car parts, and with the income he was able to expand his service. Today he sells lubricants, rims, tires, and has a tire service, where he repairs rims and tires. This business has enabled him to pay his household expenses. His wife helps by selling refreshments (beverages) from their home.

The business has a good location which enables him to get a good number of customers. The products Cruz offers are in high demand by taxis, buses, trucks, and cars, so he should have an amply supply on hand to meet the demands for his services. This loan will help him maintain his business and meet his customers demands.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Cruz Luciano tiene 34 aos de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo de 4 aos, habita en el asentamiento de Villa Reconciliacin, siendo esta una zona semirural, pobre, con calles sin pavimentar. Hace 10 aos, inicia su negocio de venta de repuestos de vehculos, con el tiempo el mismo negocio le permiti expandirse, hoy en da cuenta con venta de lubricantes, llantas, neumticos y tiene el servicio de vulcanizacin, en donde reparan llantas y neumticos, esta actividad econmica le ha permitido cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, su esposa para ayudarlo con todas las obligaciones que tienen que cumplir, vende refrescos en su vivienda.

El negocio se encuentra en una buena ubicacin, lo que le permite captar un buen nmero de clientes. Los productos que ofrece el seor son bien demandados por taxis, buses, camiones y carros particulares, por lo tanto debe de contar con un buen numero de existencia para poder satisfacer la necesidad de dicho servicio, este prstamo le ayudara a mantener su negocio con lo que los clientes requieran.

loan.use: Buy lubricants, brake fluid, tires and rims

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca was a little girl when she began to learn about sales. In the city where she was born she used to sell chicha to help in her home. One she married, it was necessary to have income, so she opened a convenience store. She began little by little, with whatever she could buy to supply her store. So, with hard wrok, she was able to stock her store with a variety of products. She has since moved to a new locale, which was good for her, her family, and her business now is in its own locale and she doesnt have to pay rent for a space. Now her store also has a bakery and small bazaar. She always has customers, and she has a dream with two her children of turning their great store in to a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde muy pequea Francisca aprendi lo concerniente a las ventas. En su pueblo natal ella sola vender chicha para ayudar en su hogar. Una vez que se cas, la necesidad de contar con un ingreso fue ms grande, lo cual la convenci de abrir una bodega. Fue empezando poco a poco, con lo nico que poda comprar para abastecer a su tienda. As, con su empeo, logro que su tienda este bien surtida de diversos productos. Hasta que llego el momento de mudarse a vivir en otro lado. Lo que fue bueno para ella, para su familia y para su negocio tambin pues ahora contaba con un local propio y no deba pagar renta por uno alquilado. Ahora su bodega se ha complementado con una panadera y un pequeo bazar. Los clientes nunca le faltan, pero el sueo de ella y de sus dos hijos es convertir su gran bodega en un minimarket.

loan.use: Convert a convenience store to a minimarket

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Janet Roxana

texts.es:
Mrs. Janet Roxana A. C. belongs to the Communal Bank Amigos Marcarinos. Her business is located in the Marcara market, in Carhuaz province, Ancash province, where she sells groceries, fruits, and vegetables.

With a previous loan of S/400 soles she bought groceries to stock her stall and thereby increase her income.

With this loan for S/800 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase: a sack of rice, bag of noodles, box of oil and vegetables to stock the business and increase sales.

Janet is 25 years old and her dream is improving her business. Her husband is a driver, offering taxi service to the Chanco Thermal Baths. Both work in order to educate their two children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Seora Janet Roxana A. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal Amigos Marcarinos, su local se encuentra ubicado en el mercado del distrito de Marcara, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y tambin ofrece frutas y verduras.

Con el prstamo anterior S/. 400.00 compro abarrotes para surtir su puesto y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.

Con este prstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertira en la compra de : un saco de arroz, una bolsa de fideos, una caja de aceite y verduras para surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.

Ella tiene 25 aos, su sueo es poder mejorar su negocio, su esposo ofrece el servicio de colectivos a los Baos Termales de Chancos, ambos trabajan para educar a sus dos hijos.

loan.use: Purchase a sack of rice, noodles and other products

loan.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amalia A. sells hot dogs and soda pop in the Terminal market in Len city. She began her business 8 years ago as a street vendor prior to establishing herself in her present locale.

She is a single mother, has one child, and is also responsible for supporting her aged mother. As her economic situation is in need, she approached Ceprodel to provide a loan that would enable her to purchase ingredients to prepare her delicious hot dogs. Today she needs to buy products such as bread, ketchup, onion, mustard, cream and sausage. So she has approached CEPRODEL again to ask for a loan and therefore improve her business and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El detalle de la actividad econmica que se dedica la seora Amalia A. es a la venta de hot dogs y gaseosas en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de Len. Su negocio inicia desde hace 8 aos ambulante en el mercado hasta establecerse en su localidad.

Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo y adems con la responsabilidad de mantener a su mam que es una humilde anciana. Debido a su situacin econmica que es muy baja, ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con crditos que le permiten la compra de los ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos hot dog. Hoy en da su necesidad es la compra de estos productos tales como pan, salsa de tomate, cebollas, mostaza, crema y chorizo. Para esto acude una vez mas a CEPRODEL para obtener los crditos y as mejorar la situacin de su negocio y familia.

loan.use: Buy condiments for hot dog business

loan.name: Mujeres San Jardin De Jorge I Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Jardin de San Jorge arrive early for their meeting at the office of Friendship Bridge in Solol, the regions capital city, about a fifteen minute bus ride uphill from their town of San Jorge la Laguna. As they wait for the previous meeting to end, they greet each other with hugs and a chorus of buenos dias and como estas, followed by excited chatter in their native language Kaqchiquel. As the other meeting lets out and the women begin to file in, the cream colored room becomes a canvas of brilliant colors, painted by the beautiful and intricate huipiles (traditional woven blouses) that each woman wears.

These huipiles are just one of many trades that the women practice. Among the eighteen, about half of them dedicate their time to weaving and sewing skirts (like the ones in the picture), scarves, purses, belts, ribbons that get woven into long braids, as well as huipiles. Ten of the 18 women are asking for a group loan of 26,000 quetzales ($3425), ranging from $150 to $400 per person, five of whom will invest in thread for their artisan business (one of them was not able to be present for the photo). Two women have jewelry businesses, making beaded bracelets, necklaces, rings and earrings that they sell in the nearby tourism capital Panajachel. Two women have small stores, selling soft drinks, snacks, chicken and sausages. And one woman, who could not be at the meeting because she was sick, has a tortillera, and will invest in the ingredients necessary for making corn and flour tortillas.

The women of Mujeres Jardin have been with Friendship Bridge for two years, but have been together as a group much longer. They were previously with another institution, but were looking for a lower interest rate, which Friendship Bridge offers. They are more than happy with their new microfinance home, and are excited to see the long-term benefits for their business that less interest will bring. In addition to lower interest, one of their favorite things about Friendship Bridge is the education they receivethey are learning how to better run their business, care for their family, and have a real hope for the future (and they like that they get to play games while they learn, too!).

loan.use: These women would like to purchase thread for weaving, as well as beads for jewelry, supplies for a store, and ingredients for tortillas.

loan.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana P. sells personal items (hair accessories, necklaces, bracelets, wallets) in the La Terminal market in Len (Nicaragua). She started her business 8 years ago with a capital of C$ 500 (five hundred crdobas net) that she had been saving since she was young.

Mrs. P. had economic difficulties obtaining the products that she sells in the market from the beginning since she had to use the little money she made to buy groceries for her family and to pay her two children's school. It's important to highlight that she is a single mother, but that has not stopped her from getting loans from Ceprodel. These loans have helped her to improve her economic situation and to keep her modest home. She has obtained 13 previous loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

El negocio al que se dedica la seora Ana P. es a la venta de cosmticos personales (colas, collares, pulseras, cartera) en el mercado la Terminal del departamento de Len en Nicaragua. Su negocio lo inicia desde hace 8 aos con un bajo capital de C$ 500 (Quinientos crdobas netos) obtenidos por sus ahorros propios desde su juventud.

Desde que inicio su negocio ha atravesado por difciles circunstancias econmicas para adquirir sus productos debido a que el poco dinero que gana lo invierte en la compra de los alimentos para su hogar y pago del colegio de sus dos hijos. Es necesario destacar que es madre soltera pero a pesar de esto, ha adquirido crditos en Ceprodel los cuales le han apoyado para mejorar su situacin econmica y continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar. Su record crediticio es de 13 crditos con la institucin.

loan.use: Compra de los cosmticos personales

loan.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Ndye Fatou P. born in 1962 and married, is a member of the Khodoba Village Bank since 6 and a half years. Since joining Khodoba's microfinance program, she has never had a problem respecting her loan repayments and commitments. Madame P. wishes to expand and promote her business selling fruits and vegetables (such as cabbage, sorrel, aubergine, gombo, oranges, tangerines, mangoes, etc.). Hence, she is requesting her 8th loan for a term of 6 months with one bulk reimbursement payment at the end.

Mme Ndye Fatou P., marie, ne le 30/07/1962 est membre du Banc villageois de Khodoba, six ans et demi. Depuis son entre dans le Programme de Microfinance, Mme P. n'a jamaais eu de problme pour honorer ses engagements. Elle souhaite promouvoir son commerce de fruits et lgumes (choux, oseille, aubergine, gombo, orange, mandarine, mangue, etc.). C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce 8me prt qu'elle propose de rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule chance.

loan.use: To purchase goods for resale

loan.name: Franciasco Javier

texts.es:
Being a barber is very common in Nicaraguas Len city. In the Terminal market, Mrs. Francisco P. has been a barber for 15 years, taking care of men and women. He is known for being an efficient worker.

As with all jobs, this profession needs materials such as combs, gels, powders and clippers. Each one of these materials has an expense and therefore, Francisco first wisely approached Ceprodel 3 years ago and has benefited from loans that he has used to improve his business and support his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de barbera es muy comn en la ciudad de Len en Nicaragua. En el mercado la Terminal, el seor Francisco P. se dedica a este negocio desde hace 15 aos atendiendo ambos sexos y siendo muy reconocido por ser un eficiente trabajador.

Como todo trabajo, el desempeo de esta labor requiere de inversin en materiales como peines, gelatina, talco y maquina de cortar pelo. Cada uno de estos materiales tiene un costo y para esto, muy sabiamente el seor Francisco ha acudido a Ceprodel desde hace 3 aos y ha sido beneficiado con crditos que los ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su negocio y en el sustento de su hogar.

loan.use: Buy barber shop supplies

loan.name: Sonia Nancy

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia Nancy H. F. is a member of the Communal Bank Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Feria. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Yungay market in Ancash state.

With a prior loan of S/800 soles, she increased her merchandise and income.

With this loan of S/500 soles which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy apples, bananas, pineapples, mandarin oranges, oranges, and grapes.

She is 34 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is a driver. Both work to support their home and educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Sonia Nancy H. F. , es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras ,su local esta ubicado en el mercado de Yungay del departamento de Ancash.

Con el crdito anterior de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su mercadera y sus ingresos.

Con este prstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertir en la compra de : manzana, pltano, pia, mandarina, naranja, uva

Ella tiene 34 aos de edad, es conviviente con 5 hijos su esposo es chofer, ambos se apoyan para sacar adelante su hogar y la educacin de sus hijos.

loan.use: Purchase fruit

loan.name: Jernima De Los nge

texts.es:
Mrs. Jeronima has been selling vegetables for 10 years. She began with her own savings, selling the Terminal market of Len.

Her business selling vegetables began as a street vendor with a small cart selling throughout the market, and then she found her own locale but it was in poor condition. Jeronima is a married woman with 5 children to support, and they are the source of her strength to build a successful business.

She has benefited from working with Ceprodel for 2 years, assisting her with 13 loans that have greatly impacted her vegetable businesss growth and has raised her standard of living and that of her children. She needs a loan from Ceprodel to acquire a large amount of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad econmica de la seora Jeronima es la venta de verduras variadas teniendo su negocio desde hace 10 aos que dio inicio con sus propios ahorros en el mercado la Terminal de Len.

Su negocio de venta de verduras lo inicia vendiendo ambulante con una pana pequea por todo el mercado y posteriormente se ubica en un local propio pero en malas condiciones. Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella es una dama casada y con 5 hijos a su cargo por lo que ellos son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos en el negocio.

Ha sido beneficiada desde hace dos aos por Ceprodel quien le asisti con financiamiento habindoles otorgado 13 crditos de los que le han impactado en un mayor crecimiento de su negocio de verduras y adems ha mejorado su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos. Su necesidad por la que solicita el crdito a Ceprodel es por la adquisicin de mayores volmenes de verduras.

loan.use: Purchase vegetables

loan.name: Josefa De La Concepc

texts.es:
The sale of fruits and vegetables is a very popular business in the market of La Terminal in Leon since there are many retailers that sell them in this town. One of them is Mrs. Josefa U., also known as Chepita, who has been working very hard in this business for the last 22 years.

Mrs. Chepita needs to buy the produce (fruits and vegetables) from the whole sale retail sellers but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason she's approaching Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan to purchase produce from the whole sale retail sellers. It's important to highlight that as of right now she has duly paid the five loans that she has requested in time and according to the conditions established.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Un negocio muy populas en el mercado de la Terminal en Leon es la venta de frutas y verduras debido a que existen muchas comerciantes que se dedican a este negocio en esta localidad. Una de ellas es la seora Josefa U. conocida comnmente como chepita que desde hace 22 largos aos se ha dedicado a este negocio muy esforzadamente

Una necesidad atravesada actualmente por chepita es la adquisicin de sus productos (frutas y verduras) ya que los debe comprar a sus proveedores y al no contar con el dinero suficiente acude a Ceprodel para que le otorgue crditos para la compra de sus productos a sus proveedores. Es necesario destacar que actualmente tiene un record de 5 crditos pagados en tiempo y forma segn lo establecido.

loan.use: Purchasing produce

loan.name: Karla Nadia

texts.es:
Mrs. Karla R. has been selling clothes of all sizes and for all ages for the last 15 years in the La Terminal market of Len. She has worked very hard and has invested much money to obtain and keep her own slot in the market . She has three children who have been able to go on with their schooling thanks to their mom's little business.

She started her business by selling in the traveling market, out in the sun and getting physically worn out after walking for long periods of time. Little by little, she started saving in order to invest in a slot inside the market, and, after obtaining it, she kept on selling clothes, but in smaller quantities.

Mrs. Karla is facing the need of investment of clothes to sell in her slot in the market, and that's why she's approaching Ceprodel: to benefit from a loan and buy the clothes she needs to sell. This will help to keep her family together.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 15 aos en la ciudad de Len en el mercado la Terminal, la seora Karla R. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaos y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversin y esfuerzos por mantener este negocio. Es madre de tres hijos que gracias a su apoyo han logrado salir adelante en sus estudios.

El negocio lo comienza vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponindose al sol y al desgaste fsico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenz a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo y de aqu en adelante comenz vendiendo la ropa pero en menores cantidades.

La necesidad que atraviesa la seora Karla es la inversin en compra de la mercadera es por eso que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con crditos y de esta manera adquirir la ropa para comercializarla y as seguir manteniendo su ncleo familiar.

loan.use: Clothing purchase

loan.name: Mujeres San Jardin De Jorge Ii Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Jardin de San Jorge have been with Friendship Bridge for two years now, but were previously with another finance institution. They werent happy there and set out to find lower interest rates, which they found with Friendship Bridge.

They are excited to see the long-term benefits these savings will bring to their business and are planning accordingly.

Of the eighteen women, half of them are artisans, weaving beautiful huipiles, traditional Mayan blouses as well as skirts, purses, and scarves.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 16,500 quetzales ($2175) ranging from $150 to $400 per person. Four of these women will invest in colorful threads to weave and sew.

One woman has a jewelry business, selling beaded bracelets, necklaces and earrings in the nearby tourist capital, Panajachel. In addition to purchasing materials, she plans to hire an employee to increase her production.

The other three women (one who could not be in the picture) have small tiendas, stores, where they sell soft drinks, snacks, chicken and sausages. These women have a goal of opening additional stores, where they will offer an expanded variety of products, ranging from food to basic commodity products.

All these women have children, sometimes as many as eight each and they dream of being able to better provide for their families.

With a lower interest rate, they are able to invest in more materials, therefore producing more and earning a higher income. With this added income, the women are able to provide better education for their children as they can purchase the books, clothing and supplies they need.

All of them whish that their children will finish school and become professionals so that they dont have to struggle in the same ways they have had to.

loan.use: To purchase thread for weaving, beads for jewelry, and supplies for small stores.

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Elena P.'s primary job has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past 23 years, in the market La Terminal in Leon. She began her business with an investment of $500 (500 cordobas), the result of her efforts to save enough money.

Her business began with her acting as a sort of traveling saleswoman, selling her wares on the streets of Leon, with a basket where she placed her fruits and vegetables. However, she noticed that her business was not able to support her family and her four small children. And so, with the hope of progressing little by little, she asked for a loan from Ceprodel, who offered her a friendly hand and helped her to push forward the success of her small business. Today, she has been able to develop her business, making a little bit more money, which is used to buy more products. But, she finds herself in a difficult position where she needs to ask for another loan in order to stock her fruits and vegetables, the larger quantity of products will mean more revenue and better support for her family.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Seora Maria Elena P. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 23 aos ubicada en el mercado La Terminal en Len. Inicia con un capital inicial de C$ 500 ( Quinientos crdobas), producto de sus esfuerzos en ahorros.

Su negocio lo inicia vendiendo ambulante en las calles de Len con una pana donde colocaba sus verduras y frutas, sin embargo al darse cuenta que este negocio no le cubra para mantener a sus cuatro pequeos hijos, decide con la esperanza de ir progresando poco a poco solicitar prstamos a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le ayuda para salir adelante en su negocio. Hoy en da ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio obteniendo un poco mas de ingresos para la compra de las verduras y frutas. Pero aun atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir los productos para comercializarlos y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.

loan.use: To purchase fruits and vegatables

loan.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix's call shop recently marked its one year anniversary. However, this isn't the only business that he runs. He also has a restaurant that is progressing with the help of his wife and children.

With the idea of making the most of the success that call shops were having a year ago, and with the goal of giving his children more work, he decided to open this business. Nevertheless, the competition is a factor that he has to fight every day because currently there are two call shops on every corner of the district where Felix lives. This is why he would like to implement more modern equipment in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El locutorio de Flix tiene recin un ao en funcionamiento. Sin embargo, este no el nico negocio que l maneja. A la par, tiene tambin un restaurante que con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos lo saca adelante.

Con la idea de aprovechar el xito que tenan los locutorios hace un ao y con el propsito de darles ms trabajo a sus hijos, decidi abrir este negocio. No obstante, la competencia es un factor con el que debe lidiar diariamente ya que en la actualidad hay dos locutorios en cada esquina en el distrito donde Flix vive. Por esto, le gustara implementar con equipos ms modernos su local.

loan.use: To implement more modern equipment in his call shop

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Maria Jos

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Jose Rios is a native to the city of Leon. She runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables in the market La Terminal, in the beautiful city of Leon. Her business stands out because it is very popular and is visited by customers who sympathize with Maria because of her humble nature and attentiveness to her customers.

Mrs. Rios needs to purchase more fruits and vegetables from her wholesalers and this is why she is asking Ceprodel for a loan that would be used wholly for this purpose. It is important to point out that ever since she became involved in the loan process with Ceprodel she has been very punctual with her payments and consistent with agreed upon requirements and rules.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La seora Maria Jos R. originaria de la ciudad de Len, se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado la Terminal de esta bella ciudad. Su negocio se caracteriza por ser muy popular debido a que es muy visitada por clientes quienes se sienten muy identificada con ella por ser una muy humilde persona que atiende muy bien a sus clientes.

La necesidad de la seora R. es la compra de las frutas y verduras a sus proveedores y es por tal motivo que acude a CEPRODEL para que se le otorgue crdito y usarlo directamente en la compra de sus productos. Es de importancia destacar que desde que ha adquirido crditos con esta institucin ha sido fiel con sus pagos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loan.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loan.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo Lopez is a gentleman, originally from the city of Leon and he has run a barbershop in the market La Terminal for 14 years now. He is married and has two small children who are school aged now. Alongside his wife, he fights for a better financial situation to give to his small nuclear family.

Currently, Mr. Pablo Lopez finds himself in a precarious position, because he needs to buy more tools for his barbershop like scissors, talcum powder, gels and combs, yet lacks sufficient funds. This is why he has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan that would allow him to improve his small business which would directly help him to continue to support his family.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Pablo L. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Len y que tiene su negocio de barbera en el mercado la Terminal desde hace 14 aos. Es casado y con dos pequeos hijos en edad escolar y junto con su esposa lucha para mejorar la situacin financiera de su ncleo familiar.

Actualmente la situacin que atraviesa el seor Pablo L. es la necesidad de adquirir sus enseres de barbera como lo son tijeras, talco, gelatina, cepillo. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para obtener crditos que le permitan mejorar la situacin de su negocio y a la vez continuar manteniendo a su familia.

loan.use: To purchase more tools for his babershop

loan.name: Mujeres Chuisequec I Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Chuisequc have traveled about an hour from their farming community of Concepcin to the regions capital city, Solol, for their meeting at the Friendship Bridge office.

They gather quickly and expectantly, dressed in their traditional Mayan clothing, they calm their babies and whisper to each other in their native language, Kaqchiquel, as they wait. The loan officer begins, and all eyes are on her.

Mujeres Chuisequc have been together for two years now. They began with three women and are now up to eighteen. The word spread quickly about the loans from Friendship Bridge and how they helped business, and the eighteen women in the room are eager and hopeful, ready to put their loans to good use.

All but two of them have small farms in which they grow potatoes, carrots, onions, radishes, beans, broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes, lemongrass, and chamomile. The farms are located in Concepcin, an area with a temperate climate and a rich soil that allows for year-round farming. Ten of the women are asking for a group loan of 21,500 quetzales ($2825), ranging from $150 to $400, all which will be invested in farming. They will use the money to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

The women of Mujeres Chuisequc have large families- up to ten kids each. As they go to sign their names, all but two of them sign with a thumbprint, indicating they cannot write. The women express that everything they do is for their children. They work hard every day and do everything possible to provide for their families so that their children can receive an education and have lives with more opportunities and far less suffering than what they have had to endure.

loan.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loan.name: Petrona Marcelina

texts.es:
Ms. Petrona L. began her small business 20 years ago, selling fruits and vegetables in Leon, in the market La Terminal. Because she has a small site established and installations constructed in the market, one of the goals of Petrona is to now improve the infrastructure of her business.

She has asked Ceprodel for a loan that would allow her to purchase more fruits and vegetables. With the financial support from Ceprodel, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her two children and herself. Furthermore, she has begun to save money so that she can invest in reconstruction of her current site in the market where she works.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La dama Petrona L. inicia su pequeo negocio hace 20 aos vendiendo frutas y verduras en Len en el mercado la Terminal. Debido a que tiene un pequeo local establecido en las instalaciones del mercado una de las metas de la seora Petrona es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener crditos que le permitan la adquisicin de las frutas y verduras. Con el aporte econmico obtenido por los prestamos de CEPRODEL ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y sus dos hijos y adems ha iniciado a ahorrar para la reconstruccin de su negocio en el mercado donde ella labora.

loan.use: To purchase more products.

loan.name: Saida De La Concepci

texts.es:
Since 28 years, Mrs Saida sells vegetables at the La Terminal market in the city of Leon. She decided to ask for a loan in order to have her own market stand and buy more products.

Her dream is to improve the standard of living of her family (including her 4 children).

Saida believes that the financial support she has received from CEPRODEL has been a key factor for the development of her business. Nowadays, she has improved her sales and would like to receive another loan to buy even more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Saida se dedica a esta actividad de venta de verduras desde hace 28 aos ubicndose en el mercado la Terminal en la ciudad de Len.

Con la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos decide solicitar prestamos para tener un local propio, incrementar su inventario en fin el de realizar sus sueos mejorar en todos los aspectos de su vida.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente ha mejorado sus ventas y hoy en da una vez mas acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con crditos que son invertidos directamente en la compra de sus productos.

loan.use: To buy more vegetables and get her own market-stand

loan.name: Timotea Sinforosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Timotea is a widow with two children to take care of. She currently finds herself in a difficult position because she has to be both father and mother to her children and also dedicate herself to her job selling clothing in the market La Terminal in the district of Leon. Before beginning this business, Mrs. Timotea sold clothes as a sort of traveling saleswoman, on the streets. However, the revenue from this system of selling was insufficient to support her family. Confronting this problem, she decided to collect more quantities of clothing to resell in the market. She seeks out the cheapest or most affordable venders of clothing in various places in her district so as to make a better profit when reselling them. To date, she has finished 14 loans with CEPRODEL which has helped her to collect enough money to purchase clothing from her venders and furthermore, in ways, has improved the quality of life in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La seora Timotea es una madre viuda y con dos hijos que mantener. Actualmente atraviesa una difcil situacin por el hecho de que hace el papel de padre y madre y adems se dedica a la venta de ropa en lo interno del mercado la Terminal en el Departamento de Len.

Antes de iniciar este negocio en su local la seora Timotea se dedicaba a realizar las ventas en la calle al aire libre pero sus bajos ingresos eran insuficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Partiendo de este problema, decide muy firmemente comenzar a adquirir mas cantidades de ropa para comercializarla por lo que realiza cotizaciones en varios lugares para seleccionar al proveedor que mas barato le venda la ropa.

Hoy en dia ha realizado un total de 14 crditos en CEPRODEL que le han sido de sumo apoyo ya que ha adquirido la ropa de sus proveedores y adems ha mejorado en parte las condiciones de su localidad.

loan.use: To purchase clothing

loan.name: Seynabou A.

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou A. F., 44 and married, is a member of the Khodoba Village Bank since 6 and half years. Madame F. is asking for a loan to grow her business selling fruit (Organges, watermelon, tangerines, etc.). She is hoping that the money she earns from growing her business will help her manage maintenance costs and improve her boutique's infra-structure.

Seynabou is one of the best clients within Caurie's Khodoba Village Bank, maintaining a solid reimbursement history. This will be her 8th loan with a term of 6 months and 1 payment at the end of the loan term.

Mme Seynabou A. F. est ge de 44 ans, marie. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de Khodoba depuis six ans et demis. Afin d'aider lentretien de son foyer, elle souhaite renforcer son commerce de fruits (Orange, pastque, mandarine, clmentine, etc.). Elle fait partie des meilleurs clientes de son groupe. Elle sollicite un 8me prt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule chance.

loan.use: To purchase goods for resale

loan.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flors current work was an initiative of her sister who, because of a trip, left the business to her. Prior to this Flor worked with her husband as a fare collector in a public transport line. This work, although it generated income, left her very tired at the end of the day. As the years went by she began to look for another job and her sisters trip was a coincidence. She gladly accepted the fruit stand her sister left her. She has been selling fruit and orange juice now for two years. Thanks to this work she is helping to build and maintain her house. What she would like most of all is to fix up the stand that she has, as it has deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El actual trabajo de Flora en un inicio era de su hermana, quien por motivos de viaje, se lo dejo a ella. Anteriormente, Flor trabajaba junto a su esposo como cobradora de una lnea de transporte pblico. Este trabajo, si bien le generaba ingresos, al final del da ella terminaba muy cansada. Con el paso de los aos ella empez a buscar otro trabajo y el viaje de su hermana fue una coincidencia. As que acepto con mucho gusto manejar el puesto de frutas que se le concedi. Ya lleva dos aos vendiendo frutas y jugo de naranja. Gracias a este trabajo est ayudando en la construccin de su casa y al mantenimiento de esta. Lo que ella ms quisiera es poder arreglar el puesto que tiene, ya que esta degradado por el tiempo.

loan.use: Remodel her stand.

loan.name: Ta Thi Phuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. T Th Phng A., 30 years old, is A. active womA.. Her vision of the city expansion has encouraged her to open a gas station. Due to her lack of experience the start up failed. She and her husband tried again with a different project, a plastic recycle plant. She has a better luck this time. The operation is steady together with good income. Currently her plant has around 10 employees. The production is sold to bigger plants in Hanoi, Hng Yn and some other provinces. The business keeps expanding and gains good reputation. This time she is applying for a loA. of 1,200USD to stock more scrap plastic. The plant needs more capital that is why she hopes she cA. be approved for bigger loans, 5,000-6,000USD. The monthly income is 500-550USD. She has 3 school age children.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


L mt trong rt t thnh vin tr nhng nng ng v mnh dn u t d n ln, tn dng li th v iu kin thun li nh t ai rng, gn ng giao thng, bA. u ch T Th Phng A., 30 tui, u t m ca hng Gas nhng do thiu kinh nghim, ng vn nh hp nn vic kinh doanh b thua l phi b d. Vn l ngi dm ngh dm lm, khng chu chp nhn tht bi, ch A. cng chng li tm kim v hc hi nhiu kinh nghim nhiu ni vi nhiu ngh khc nhau. c mt ngi bn mch nc, ch Thanh v chng cng gp vn vi anh trai m xng sn xut nha nguyn liu. Sau mt thi giA., cng vic i vo n nh v cho thu nhp tt. Hin ti xng ca gia nh ch ang c gn chc cng nhn ang trc tip sn xut. Sn phm nha nguyn liu ca gia nh lm ra c cung cp cho cc nh my sn xut nha H Ni, Hng Yn v mt s tnh khc c khch hng rt tin cy nn cng vic ngy cng pht trin. Vng vn ny ch A. xin vay 1200USD thu mua nha v ti ch. Nhu cu s dng vn ca ch A. rt ln nn nguyn vng ca ch cng gia nh l Qu cho vay mc vn ln hn (khong 5000-6000USD) tip tc u t m rng d n. Thu nhp ca ch A. l 500-550USD/thng. Ch c 3 con cn nh ang trong tui i hc.

loan.use: Buy wasted plastic

loan.name: Mujeres Chuisequec Ii Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Chuisequc enter their meeting at the Friendship Bridge office, their strong faces colored by the wind and the sun they daily endure as they take care of their farms.

They have traveled an hour from their community of Concepcin, where the soil is rich and the climate good, allowing for year-round farming. All but two of the eighteen women have small farms, where they grow potatoes, carrots, onions, radishes, beans, broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes, lemongrass, and chamomile (quite a variety!).

They whisper to each other in their native language Kaqchiquel, eagerly awaiting approval of the loans they have requested.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 18,500 quetzales ($2425), ranging from $150 to $400 each. Of the eight, six will invest in seeds and fertilizer for their farms.

One woman is an artisan, weaving beautiful huipiles, traditional Mayan blouses known for their intricate and colorful designs. She will invest in thread for her weavings.

Another woman is a comerciante (commerce women), buying a variety of goods in bulk and selling them at local markets. With her loan, she will buy a greater quantity of each item, lowering the price per item and increasing her profits.

Each woman of Mujeres Chuisequc has a family to take care of; some even have up to ten children.

They express that everything they do is to improve the lives of their children so they can receive an education and learn to read and write. This will open them new opportunities and avoid them the suffering their mothers have had to endure.

As they go to sign their names, all but two sign with a thumbprint, indicating they cannot write. But they sign with pride, knowing that with this loan they are doing everything in their power to give their children the right tools to learn and later on sign their names with a pen.

loan.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer, as well as thread for weaving and goods in bulk

loan.name: Kieu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Kiu Th Sn, 27 years old, lives with her husband and a 6 years old S. in Sc Sn. She joins the TYM Fund in 2001 when her S. was 8 months old. The funds of her first loan was invested in wedding parties such as china, utensils and decorative items for her rental business. Though the income was hefty in wedding seaS., off seaS. had different story. In 2006, she converts her rental business to a refreshment distributor which serves fruits and refreshment to general population and also other businesses as well. This business gives a more stable monthly income of 300USD. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to stock more goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Kiu Th Sn, 27 tui, sng cng chng v 1 con trai 6 tui ti Sc Sn. Ch Sn bt u tham gia Qu t nm 2001, sau khi sinh con c 8 thng. S vn vay ln u c ch Sn u t mua phng bt, bt a cho thu m ci. Mi ln cho thu mang li cho ch li nhun vi chc USD. Thu nhp bnh qun cng kh nhng vo nhng thng khng phi trong ma ci thng khng c vic. Nm 2006 ch Sn chuyn sang bun bn bnh ko, hoa qu, nc gii kht phc v nhu cu tiu dng ca ngi dn trong a phng v bn bun cho cc ca hng trong huyn. Do hot ng kinh doanh phc v m ci t thi gian trc nn ca hng ca ch c rt nhiu ngi bit n. Thu nhp bnh qun ca ca hng t 300USD/thng. Vi kh nng pht trin ca ca hng nn vng vn ny ch Sn tip tc xin vay 1200USD mua bnh ko, ru bia.

loan.use: Buy confectionary, wine, beer

loan.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara has been selling chickens in a market near her house for ten years. She started with the idea of helping her husband maintain their home, since the income he earned as a carpenter wasn't enough.

Upon finding out about the inauguration of the market, she didn't hesitate to leave the stand that she had and to start working in the market. She invested what she earned, so little by little, she could afford to buy the stand in the market.
