Clara is a young, hard-working woman. She is only 34-years-old, and she plans to build another stand. She has a husband and two children, who are 14 and 3-years-old. Her children are her strength. Because of them, she feels capable of doing anything and strives to progress more and more.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace diez aos que Clara vende pollos en un mercado cercano a su casa. Ella empez con la idea de ayudar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar, ya que sus ingresos como carpintero no eran suficientes. Al enterarse de la inauguracin de un mercado no dudo en separar su puesto y ponerse a trabajar en l. Lo que ganaba lo volva a invertir, y as poco a poco pudo comprar el puesto.

Clara es una mujer joven y muy trabajadora. Cuenta con solo 34 aos y ya planea construir otro puesto. Tiene un esposo y dos hijos de catorce y tres aos, quienes son su fortaleza. Por ellos, se siente capaz de todo y tiene las ganas de progresar cada vez ms.

loan.use: To construct another stand

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Kaksija I Group

texts.en:
Seated on plastic chairs, wooden boards, or the ground, the women of the community bank Kaksija gather in the home of one of the members, talking in their native language Kiche, treating each other like family after almost eight years of being together as a group.

Waiting for the meeting to begin, some women nurse their babies, others work on craft projects, and others catch up on the weekly news. The fourteen women of the group dedicate themselves to artisan crafts, primarily to huipiles, a traditional Mayan blouse woven with intricate patterns. They also specialize in other typical clothing, such as the skirts you see in the photo.

The women of Kaksija are strong and wise. Most have been practicing their trade since their childhood, and have perfected the art. They sell their clothing in nearby markets, but are now looking for ways to expand their business. They would like to break into the tourist market surrounding Lake Atitlan, about an hour and a half away.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 17,500 quetzales ($2300), ranging from $150 to $400 per person, with which they will purchase thread for weaving, and two of these women are hoping to also invest in a sewing machine, in hopes to increase production as well as quality of their sewing.

All eight of the women have children, with some of the older women having as many as ten. They dream of expanding their business in order to better provide for their kids, so that they can receive an education and have more opportunity in their lives.

loan.use: To purchase thread for weaving and a sewing machine

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyn Th Gi, 39 years old, lives in Sc Sn. She joins the TYM Fund in 1994. The funds of her first loan was invested in a food stand which serves inexpensive breakfast items. She was young and energetic. Her house situates right at Rout 133, near by the headquarter of the Air Force division and other government offices. From a small breakfast stand, she expands it to a full-fledged restaurant, Phc-Gi. The restaurant has three employees with monthly salary of 50USD each. Her monthly income is 350USD. She is applying for a loan of 1,200USD to stock more goods. She hope she can be approved with her next loan of 3,000USD,

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Nguyn Th Gi, 39 tui, sng ti Sc Sn l thnh vin tham G. Qu nm 1994. Vn vay vng 1 c ch u t bn hng n sng vi nhng mn n ngon ming, r tin, c trng ca vng nng thn Vit Nam nh xi , cho g, bnh np, bnh rn ... Mc d cn tr nhng ch Gi l mt ph n nng ng tho vt, nh li ngay mt ng 131, cnh s on khng qun v cc c quan, thun tin giao thng, nn ch bn vi anh sa cha nng cp nh m rng kinh doanh hng n. Vi ci rt thu ngi dui 10 , nu bn c thi gian v mun lm m lng mnh b p nng lng tiu hao xin mi n vi nh hng Phc-Gi vi mn khoi khu lu lng b-g. Hin ti ch Gi thu 3 ngi gip vic vi mc lng thng 50USD. Vi thu nhp 350USD/thng ca ca hng, vng vn ny ch Gi xin vay 1200USD mua thc phm, ung thu ht thm ngy cng ng khch. Trong tng lai, d nh ca ch l mun vay thm 3000USD u t nh hng ti mt a im khc.

loan.use: Buy food, drink

loan.name: Yanira Irma

texts.es:
Yanina Irma B. O. belongs to the "Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa" community bank and she has a stationery supply store, in a rented space located near the Instituto Pedaggico school in Huaraz, in the Ancash region.

With a prior loan she has been able to increase her supply of merchandise and her income.

With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of supplies such as pencils, paints, erasers, notebooks, rulers, construction paper, etc. for the school year.

She is 31 years old, a single mother, has a daughter and lives with her 65-year-old mother. With her income she supports her daughter and mother.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Yanina Irma B. O. pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa, tiene una librera bazar, en un local alquilado, ubicado cerca al Instituto Pedaggico de Huaraz, Regin Ancash.

Con el crdito anterior, ha podido incrementado su mercadera y sus ingresos.

Con este prstamo el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertir en la compra de mercadera como: lapiceros, temperas, correctores, cuadernos, reglas, cartulinas, etc. para la campaa escolar.

Ella tiene 31 aos de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, vive con su Mam de 65 aos de edad, con los ingresos que tiene apoya a su hija y madre.

loan.use: Purchase supplies for the school year to stock her stationery store.

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyn Th Phng, 32 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund since 2002. She took out her first loan of 125USD to open a hair salon. Her energetic and skillful nature made her shop a crowded place. In 2006, she acquired bridal make-up, dressing and photographing skills and expanded her shop to a bridal do-all shop. The monthly income is 450USD. Though busy, she always whole heartedly participates in the Funds activities and helps other members. She lives with her husband and two children in Quang Tin, Sc Sn. This time, she is applying a loan of $1200 to buy bridal gowns and cosmetics for her shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Ch Nguyn Th Phng, 32 tui, l thnh vin Qu Tnh thng nm 2002. Vng vn u ch vay ca Qu 125USD u t vo ca hng ct tc gi u. Bn thn l mt ngi c tay ngh v nhit tnh vi cng vic nn khch n ca hng ngy mt ng. Kinh t pht trin, nm 2006 ch Phng hc thm ngh trang im c du v cho thu o ci, chp nh. Khch hng ca ch l nhng i la yu nhau v nhng cp chun b ci. Thu nhp bnh qun mt thng ca ca hng t 450USD. Mc d rt bn rn vi cng vic nhng trong thi gian tham gia Qu ch Phng lun hon thnh tt trch nhim ca mnh, v sn sng gip ch em trong cm khi gp kh khn. Hin ti ch Phng ang sng cng chng v 2 con ti Quang Tin, Sc Sn. Vng vn ny ch xin vay 1200USD mua o ci v m phm.

loan.use: Buy bridal gowns and cosmetics

loan.name: Aida

texts.es:
When her husband was left without a job because of an illness, Aida searched desperately for a way to pay the bills of her home and the medical bills of her husband, who suffered from diabetes.

At first, because of a lack of resources, she bought her merchandise at retail prices, by the kilo. Little by little, with the help of one of her daughters, she increased her sales and started to buy larger quantities of her products. She says that this business isn't going badly for her, but she does earn very little compared to the work and effort she puts into her business every day. Upon having the opportunity of receiving financial support, she would like to open a bazaar and sell clothing in the same market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo a causa de una enfermedad, Aida busc desesperadamente la forma de mantener los gastos de su vivienda y la salud de su esposo, quien padeca de diabetes.

En un inicio, Aida por falta de recursos, compraba su mercadera al por menor, por kilos. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de una de sus hijas pudo aumentar sus ventas y comprar por mayores cantidades sus productos. Ella afirma que no le va mal en este negocio; sin embargo, asegura ganar muy poco comparado al trabajo y esfuerzo que pone a diario en l. De tener la oportunidad de recibir un apoyo financiero le gustara abrir un bazar y vender ropa en el mismo mercado.

loan.use: To begin constructing a clothing bazaar.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Virginia Mercedes

texts.es:
Seora Virginia Mercedes M. J. belongs to the communal bank "Nio Manuelito". She is a member of an association of vendors of construction material (concrete mix and gravel). She takes these materials to the quarry to sell them, which is in the city of Huaraz in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 1,000 nuevos soles, she invested in the purchase of tools for her business.

With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will invest in her business to increase her income.

She is 39-years-old, and she works together with her husband to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La seora Virginia Mercedes M. J., pertenece al Banco Comunal Nio Manuelito ella es socia en la asociacin de vendedores de materiales de construccin ( arena hormign, ripio) extrae estos materiales para venderlos en la cantera, esto en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crdito anterior de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo invirti en la compra para comprar de herramientas para su negocio.

Con este prstamo S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 8 meses lo invertir en su negocio para poder mejorar sus ingresos .

Ella tiene 39m aos, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo para educar a sus hijos.

loan.use: She will invest the loan in her business

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Seora Vilma V. G. belongs to the communal bank, "Nio Manuelito". She has a grocery store and also sells food that she prepares. Her business is located in Huaraz in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 1,000 nuevos soles, she invested in her business to increase her sales and her income.

With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy soft drinks, beer, and rice. She will also buy sugar and oil to prepare food.

She is 41-years-old, her husband is a driver, and both work to take good care of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La seora VilmaV. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal Nio Manuelito, ella tiene su bodega y tambin se dedica a la venta de alimentos, su negocio esta ubicado en Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crdito anterior de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles lo invirti en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos.

Con este prstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual ser cancelado en 8 meses , comprara gaseosas, cerveza y arroz, azcar, aceite para la elaboracin de alimentos.

Ella tiene 41 aos de edad, su esposo es chofer y ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loan.use: With this loan, she will buy products to increase the amount of her merchandise

loan.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
For the past 5 years Ramn has worked as a security guard at the Treasury and Public Finance Ministry, where he works 12-hour shifts daily. The income he receives allows him to maintain his family decently. His wife takes care of household chores and raising their son.

This family lives in a housing project, their home is small and shows signs of deterioration because they have not been able to make any improvements due to lack of resources. It is urgent for this family to build a wall on the left side of their house, which currently is in poor condition. Because this part of their house is open, with no security or protection, Ramn fears that delinquents will break in and take all of their possesions which he has worked so hard to obtain.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Don Ramn tiene 5 aos de desempearse como guarda de seguridad en el Ministerio de Hacienda y Crdito Pblico, trabaja por turno de 12 horas diarias, los ingresos que percibe este seor le ha permitido mantener a la familia con decoro, su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar y la manutencin de su hijo.

Esta familia habita en un asentamiento, su vivienda es pequea, presenta malas condiciones debido a que no han podido mejorar por completo la vivienda por la falta de recursos, la urgencia de esta familia es de construir el muro lateral del costado izquierdo de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones. Al tener esa parte de la casa abierta, sin seguridad ni proteccin, el seor teme que los delincuentes se le metan a despojarlos de sus pertenencias que tanto trabajo le ha costado obtener.

loan.use: Buy cinder blocks, sand, rocks and metal to build a wall.

loan.name: Kaksija Ii Group

texts.en:
Dressed in traditional Mayan clothing with babies wrapped in blankets on their back, the women of the community bank Kaksija enter one by one into the home of one of the members, where they gather for their monthly meeting.

They speak rapidly in their native language of Kiche, and when necessary, the younger members translate from Spanish for the older members of the group. These fourteen women know each other well, having been together for almost eight years.

They dedicate themselves to traditional artisan crafts, primarily to the intricate art of weaving huipiles, beautiful hand-woven blouses than can take up to a month to produce. They also sew skirts and scarves, such as the ones in the picture.

As members of their community bank, these women have not only become friends and confidants, but they also support each other in business and give advice on loans. If a new member enters the group, the other women make sure that she understands what it means to receive a loan, and the importance of paying back on time. They help each other, sharing business tips and loan advice, ensuring that each member is successful.

Six women of the community bank are asking for a group loan of 16,000 quetzales ($2100), ranging from $150 to $400 per person. They will invest this money in colorful thread for their weaving and one woman is hoping to purchase a sewing machine that will enable her to rapidly increase her productivity, as well as the quality of her product.

All the women have children and they dream of being able to provide them an education so they can have better lives with more opportunities.

loan.use: To purchase thread for weaving and a sewing machine

loan.name: Norma

texts.es:
Mrs Norma Len Bedn belongs to the Community Bank Kid Manuelito. She sells food at the riverside of the Santa River, where people work extracting sand, gravel and cement, amongst others. Her business is located in the city of Huaraz, in the Ancash district.

With a prior loan, Norma had bought main ingredients for her food like rice, oil and sugar. With this new loan of 175 USD, which she will pay in 4 months, Norma will continue to invest in ingredients for her business as noodles and rice.

She is 38 years old, has 4 little children and her husband is a driver. The main objective of their work is to be able to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Norma Len Bedn, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nio Manuelito, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos, en las canteras del Ro Santa donde las personas trabajan sacando hormign, arena fina, ripio y otros. Este negocio se ubica en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crdito anterior ella compro artculos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azcar, aceite para la preparacin de alimentos. Con este prstamo de S/. 500 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses lo invertir en la comprara de productos para su negocio como: arroz, fideos, etc

Ella tiene 38 aos de edad, 4 hijos pequeos, es casada su esposo es chofer eventual ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loan.use: To buy ingredients like rice and noodles

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is 23 years of age, married and has a young child. She works as a hostess in Rostipollos (a restaurant) helping to organize fun games for kids around the piatas. Her husband works as a cable TV installer and both their incomes help them to maintain their small home. Times are tough even with two incomes because the Nicaraguan economy is currently going through a difficult cycle.

Ana Maria and her husband are not able to afford taking their child to Rostipollos to celebrate his birthday, but they wish to make their home as comfortable as possible for him. Ana would like to repaint the interior with colors that would match her boys eyes and to repair the leaking roof with new zinc plates.

With the microloan they are requesting they hope to be able to improve the living conditions in their humble home

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loan.use: Purchase building materials

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 35 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Soc Son. She joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before, her family earned their stable income by the motorcycle-repairing workshop. After join the Fund, she combined the borrowed money with her savings to open a motorcycle store. Besides, she also provided warranty. Therefore, she always had a lot of customers. Currently, Mrs.T. is owning a motorcycle store right in the center of the town. Her average income is 700-800 USD/ month. Because the business is going very well, her 2 children are sent to school. They are now attending their last years of school. This time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more motorcycles, increasing stores sale.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Ch Nguyn Th Tnh, 35 tui, sng cng chng v hai con ti Sc Sn. Ch tham gia Qu nm 2003. Trc kia gia nh ch chuyn sa cha xe my, thu nhp cng n nh. Sau khi tham gia Qu c iu kin c vay vn, cng vi s tin tch ly ca gia nh ch Tnh cng chng u t bun bn xe my. Ngoi bun bn, ch cng bo hnh sa cha xe nn ca hng lun ng khch. Hin nay, ch c mt ca hng bun bn xe mi, c rt khang trang rng ri ngay trung tm x. Thu nhp bnh qun mt thng ca ca hng t 700-800USD. Vic kinh doanh thun li nn hai con ca ch tnh c b m to iu kin cho hc hnh n ni n chn. Hin nay hai chu ang hc nhng nm cui cp. Vng vn ch xin vay 1200USD mua bn xe my, tng doanh thu cho ca hng.

loan.use: Buy motorbike

loan.name: Elena Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Elena Isabel A. M. belongs to the communal bank of "Amigos Marcarinos". She grows and sells guinea pigs in her home which is located in the district of Marcara, province of Carhuaz, department of Ancash. She sells the guinea pigs in the city of Huaraz which is 30 minutes away from Marcara. She also sells them directly to the tourist resorts in the city.

With her previous credit of S/. 200.00 she invested in her business to improve her sales and income. With this new loan of S./ 200.00 which will be paid back in 4 months, she'll buy food for her animals so that she can sell them in good health.

She is 39 years old and has two children. Her husband does many jobs such as gas fitter and electrician. They both work to get their family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lpez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Seora Elena Isabel A. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal Amigos Marcarinos, ella se dedica a la crianza y vende de cuyes, su local se encuentra en su domicilio en el Distrito de Marcara, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash, ella vede los cuyes en la ciudad de Huaraz que esta 30 minutos de Marcara, tambin los vende directo a los Recreos tursticos de su Localidad. Con el crdito anterior de S/. 200.00 invirti en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos Con este prstamo de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses, comprara alimentos para su animales para poder venderlos semanalmente. Ella tiene 39 aos, dos hijos, su esposo que desempea varios oficios como gasfitero, electricista, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loan.use: With the loan, she'll purchase food for her animals / Con el prestamo comprara alimento para sus animales

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started selling chicken by chance. 28 years ago, together with her husband, she would breed chicken and hens. Nevertheless, at some point she sold the eggs that she had in excess and later on she also started selling chicken.

Nowadays, she only breeds chicken on special occasions, like Christmas, when she receives special orders from her clients. Thanks to her business, to the help of her husband and to her inner-strength, she has been able to support her children and provide them with an education.

Isabel just turned 60 and she would like to open a store at her home to sell the chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Vender pollos solo fue una casualidad para Isabel. Hace 28 aos ella, junto a su esposo, se dedicaba a criar pollos y gallinas ponedoras de huevo. No obstante, en un tiempo tuvo la oportunidad de vender ella misma huevos, ya que los tena en grandes cantidades.

Poco a poco fue incluyendo a sus ventas los pollos que ella criaba. Hasta que se dedico por completo a la venta de pollos y dejo de lado la crianza de ellos. Solo por temporadas vuelve a la crianza, como en Navidad que lo hace porque recibe pedidos de algunos clientes. Gracias a su negocio, a la ayuda de su esposo y a la fuerza que nunca la abandona, ella ha podido mantener a sus hijos y darles educacin.

Isabel acaba de cumplir setenta aos y est pensando abrir una bodega en su casa.

loan.use: To open a butcher shop at her home (to sell chicken)

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Nueva Santa Catarina Group

texts.en:
In a modest room lit only by the sun, a woman sweeps the dirt floor and sets out multi-colored plastic chairs in preparation for the desembolsa, the meeting for the community bank Nueva Santa Catarina where its 11 members will have their requested loans approved. The women gather excitedly, talking rapidly in their native language Kiche, while their children play in the folds of their dresses, giggling timidly. These women are strong and have endured much, yet more than exhaustion they emit hope and joy. As a community bank, they are proud to have been together eight years, their bank was the first of the now four banks in their small community.

Located about an hour and a half from the regions capital, Solol, the 11 women dedicate themselves to the beautiful and intricate art of weaving huipiles, native Mayan blouses. A single huipil can take up to one month to make, and after an investment of about 200 Quetzales (about $25), they can sell it for about 500 Quetzales (about $60). Currently, the women sell their huipiles in the nearby town of Nahuala, and they are well known in their community so customers also come directly to their home to make purchases.

Of the 11 women, almost half can read and write, which is a very large percentage for the area. They are smart in business, and are looking for new ways to expand. Theyve recognized the large number of sales that tourism brings in, and are hoping to implement an export business or connect with a nearby community where tourism is more prevalent than in their town and open a market there. As a group they are asking for a loan of 33,500 Quetzales, about $4400, $400 per person, which they will invest in various colored threads to weave their huipiles. A few of the women are also planning on using part of their loan to hire extra help so they can increase the rate of production and make more sales.

loan.use: To purchase thread for weaving and hire extra help

loan.name: Clara Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Clara Francisca E. V. belongs to the Group "The Roses of Yungay". Her business is the sale of clothing for ladies and gentlemen. Two years ago she offered her products in a tricycle, and now has a small store located in the market of the district and province of Yungay.

With her previous loan for S/. 300, she purchased more merchandise with which she increased her sales. With this loan for S/. 500 which she will pay back in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of clothing for boys and girls.

She is 57 years old and married. Her 6 children already moved out so she works to help support her grandchildren and pay for the house expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lpez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La seora Clara Francisca E. V. , ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, su negocio es la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, hace dos aos ofreca sus productos en un triciclo, actualmente cuenta con un local que esta ubicado en el Campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay. Con el prstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro mercaderas con las cuales pudo incrementa ventas Con este prstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses lo invertir en la comprara de ropa para nios y nias. Ella tiene 57 aos de edad, casada con 6 hijos que estn fuera de familia, trabaja para apoyar a sus nietos y sostener los gastos de su hogar.

loan.use: With the loan, she'll purchase clothing for boys and girls / Con el prestamo comprara ropa de nio y nias

loan.name: Camilo Ernesto

texts.es:
Camilo is a young jeweller that creates and sells gold and silver jewellery. He learned his trade 13 years ago from his uncle and now he owns and operates his own jewellery shop. He meets with his clients and personally transforms their requests into beautiful hand made gold and silver jewellery.

Business is going well, thanks to a large client base and client references for future business. He has gained a reputation as a fine jeweller creating a beautiful high quality product. Sales are up and his wife is helping out so he can concentrate on dealing with the backlog of orders. Camilo wants to buy a new sales stand which his wife would manage to increase their business opportunities.

Thanks to their business venture, Camilo and his wife have achieved economic stability. Their current dream is to become parents as up until now they have dedicated all their energies to raising the business. Now they want to become a family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loan.use: Purchase 18kt gold to make jewellery

loan.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es:
Mr. Walter is a free-lance photographer with a 12-year experience. His profession has allowed him to make a living for his family. He covers weddings, birthdays, baptisms and graduations, among other events. He has a good number of clients that hire him on a temporary basis, but he is always on the outlook to make new clients and to cover important business events. Because of their tough financial situation and the high living costs, his wife sells cosmetics by catalog in workplaces and to family and friends. In this way, they support their two children. Having prioritized other expenses, they havent been able to repair the roof of their house living room, which is cracked and has holes, after many years of use. Moreover, some of the zinc sheets are loose due to the strong winds and Mr. Walter is afraid that might facilitate thieves breaking into his house. He is requesting a loan to tend to this urgent need of changing the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Walter es fotgrafo de profesin, con 12 aos en esta actividad,que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. El seor cubre bodas, cumpleaos, bautizos y graduaciones, entre otros eventos. Cuenta con un buen nmero de clientes que lo contratan temporalmente, pero siempre est en busca de capturar nuevos clientes y cubrir eventos importantes en empresas. Viendo que la situacin econmica se encuentra difcil y lo cara que est la vida, la esposa se dedica a ofrecer cosmticos en centros de trabajo, a familiares y amistades. De este modo mantienen a sus dos hijos. Por priorizar otros gastos, no han podido cambiar el techo de la sala de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra rajado y con orificios debido a los aos de uso, y hay ciertas lminas de zinc que estn flojas debido a los fuertes vientos, por lo cual teme que se le metan a despojarlo de sus pertenecias. Siendo esta una necesidad urgente, el seor solicita un prstamo para cambiar el techo.

loan.use: Purchase of zinc sheets and anti-corrosive paint.

loan.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga D. L. C. H. belongs to the "Warac" community bank. She provides tourist services for different hiking routes in the region. Her business is located in the city of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With a loan which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy trekking equipment: such as tents, sleeping bags, sleeping pads and backpacks, so she can proviD. better service to her clients.

She is 39 years old, married and the mother of a 14-year-old girl. Her husband is in the same business and both of them work to educate their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

L. seora Olga D. L. C. H. pertenece al Banco Comunal Warac, elL. se dedica a prestar servicios turstico en los diferentes circuito D. L. regin. Su local esta ubicado en L. ciudad D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el prstamo el cual ser cancelada en 6 meses elL. comprara equipos D. montaa: como carpas, bolsas D. dormir, colchonetas y mochilas, para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

ElL. tiene 39 aos, es casada y madre D. una hija D. 14 aos D. edad, su esposo tambin se dedica a este negocio, ambos trabajan para educar su hija.

loan.use: Purchase equipment for her business.

loan.name: Genara

texts.es:
When she divorced her husband 34 years ago, all of a sudden Genara faced the responsibility of caring for her five children by herself. As time went on, the sale of clothing she herself made was no longer enough to support her family. For that reason, in 1983, she decided to open a general store. Things were going well, but lack of time forced her to close the business since she needed to take care of her younger children. Because of this she continued making clothing and worked in whatever other business appeared at the time, such as the sale of fish, sale of food, etc.

Three years ago, one of her daughters suggested that she reopen the store. Since she had continued to pay the yearly business license fee to her city, it was no problem to reopen. Because of this, thanks to her daughters support and a loan from EDAPROSPRO, she able to open the store again.

With a lot of effort, Genera gets ahead in her business. Fortunately her children are grown now and help her once in a while. However, she thinks about growing the business even more because now she needs to take care of two illnesses which she suffers from, diabetes and osteoporosis.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Con el divorcio de su esposo, hace treinta y cuatro aos, Genara, de pronto, se vio con la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus cinco hijos ella sola. Conforme pasaba el tiempo, la venta de ropa que ella misma confeccionaba no era suficiente para mantener a su hogar. Por ello, en el ao 1983 decidi abrir una bodega. Todo iba yendo bien, pero la falta de tiempo la obligo a cerrar el negocio, pues deba ocuparse de atender a sus hijos menores an. As que contino con la confeccin de ropas y alguno que otro negocio que se le presentaba en el momento, como la venta de pescados, venta de comidas, etc.

Hace tres aos, una de sus hijas le propuso volver a abrir la tienda. Ya que ella continuaba pagando ao tras ao el permiso que la municipalidad le haba otorgado de tener un negocio en su casa, no fue un problema reinaugurarla. Fue as que, gracias al apoyo de su hija y al prstamo que le brindo EDAPROSPO pudo volver a abrir su bodega.

Actualmente, Genara lleva con mucho esfuerzo su negocio adelante, felizmente sus hijos ya estn grandes y la ayudan de vez en cuando. Sin embargo, ella piensa en hacer crecer su negocio aun ms porque ahora debe encargarse de las dos enfermedades que la molestan, diabetes y osteoporosis.

loan.use: Supply her store with more products.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina H. D. C. belongs to the "Mujeres del Futuro" community bank. She sells vegetables and prepared flour (flour from broad beans, dried peas and wheat). Her stand is located in the market in the city of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With a loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 3 boxes of tomatoes, 3 sacks of onions, 3 pumpkins, a sack of potatoes, 12 kilos of broad bean flour, and 12 kilos of dried pea flour.

She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 4 children; the oldest is 40 and the youngest 25. All of her children live independently. Her husband works in agriculture and both raised their children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Alejandrina H. D. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Futuro, ella se dedica ala venta D. verduras y harina preparada (harina D. haba, arvejas, trigo), su local esta ubicado en el mercado, D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el prstamo el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses , comprar, 3 cajas D. tomates, 3 sacos D. cebolla, 3 zapallos , un saco D. papas, 12 kilos D. harina D. haba, 12 kilos D. harina D. arvejas.

Ella tienen 57 aos D. edad es casada y madre D. 4 hijos, el mayor D. 40 aos y la ltima D. 25 aos, todos sus hijos son independientes, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ambos educaron a sus hijos.

loan.use: Purchase products for her business.

loan.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen Comenz en el mes de Febrero de 1993 a vender joyera , zapatos y otros artculos por catlogo, a raz de que un agente de ventas la visit su casa y al cual le platic su inquietud de poner un pequeo negocio y gracias a la asesora que le brind pudo iniciar un pequeo negocio de compra-venta de joyera. Posteriormente cambi de giro al vender ropa nueva con la cual le fue muy bien y hace 2 aos comenz a vender adems de la ropa nueva zapatos por catalogo y lencera. Carmen trabaja para poder sacar dinero para ayudarle a su esposo a pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijas, las cuales una de ellas ya termin, pero las dos ms pequeas se encuentran estudiando la preparatoria.

Sin embargo Actualmente, Carmen est solicitando un crdito de US $825 que est dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Carmen podr comprar un lote de zapatos de temporada y lencera que le permita tener un mayor surtido para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Carmen podr salir adelante y ofrecerles una carrera universitaria a sus dos hijas.

loan.use: Comprar mercanca

loan.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen began selling jewelry, shoes and other merchandise purchased from catalogs in February 1993 after a sales agent called on her at home and calmed her fears about starting a small business. Thanks to the agent's advice, she was able to start her business buying and selling jewelry. Subsequently, she turned to selling new clothing, which went well, and two years ago she added new shoes and lingerie, all purchased from catalogs for resale. Carmen works to earn money to help her husband pay expenses for their 3 daughters, two of whom are still at school.

Carmen is now asking for a US$850 loan, to be repaid in 5 months, that she can use to buy an order of seasonal shoes and lingerie so that she can offer a wider selection of them to her customers. With your help, Carmen will be able to get ahead and give her two daughters a chance at university educations.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen comenz en el mes de Febrero de 1993 a vender joyera , zapatos y otros artculos por catlogo, a raz de que un agente de ventas la visit su casa y al cual le platic su inquietud de poner un pequeo negocio y gracias a la asesora que le brind pudo iniciar un pequeo negocio de compra-venta de joyera. Posteriormente cambi de giro al vender ropa nueva con la cual le fue muy bien y hace 2 aos comenz a vender adems de la ropa nueva zapatos por catalogo y lencera. Carmen trabaja para poder sacar dinero para ayudarle a su esposo a pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijas, las cuales una de ellas ya termin, pero las dos ms pequeas se encuentran estudiando la preparatoria.

Sin embargo Actualmente, Carmen est solicitando un crdito de US $850 que est dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Carmen podr comprar un lote de zapatos de temporada y lencera que le permita tener un mayor surtido para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Carmen podr salir adelante y ofrecerles una carrera universitaria a sus dos hijas.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Adrian De Jess

texts.es:
In the El Sauce municipality in the Valle San Antonio region, Adrian de Jess Mejia is in the agriculture and livestock business with the goal of maintaining his household, which consists of his wife and his two small children who, despite their age, are a great support in the labor involved in agriculture and livestock breeding.

The Valle San Antonio region has always faced the problem of not having electric power. They have no electricity because they are situated in a rural zone. For this reason, Adrian has acquired a solar panel to have access to two lamps and a small television. When he acquired this solar panel, he was left with the obligation of paying this debt. This is why he turned to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow him to pay this debt, and in that way have access to electric power in his humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce en la comarca Valle San Antonio, el seor Adrian de Jess Mejia es dedica a al negocio de la agricultura y ganadera con el fin de mantener su hogar que consta de ella y sus dos pequeos hijos que a pesar de su edad son un gran apoyo en el trabajo de la agricultura y ganadera.

La comarca Valle San Antonio siempre ha atravesado un problema como lo es la ausencia de energa elctrica, no poseen luminarias por estar ubicados en una zona rural. Es por este motivo que el seor Adrian ha adquirido un panel solar para tener acceso a dos lmparas y un pequeo televisor. Al adquirir el panel solar queda en la obligacin de pagar esta deuda y es por esta razn que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con crditos que le permitan salir de esta deuda y de esta manera tener acceso a la energa elctrica en su humilde casa de habitacin.

loan.use: Acquire a solar panel to have electric power in his home.

loan.name: Augusto

texts.es:
In the El Sauce municipality in the city of Len, Augusto B. has been in the business of livestock and agriculture for over 40 years in his town situated in a region called Valle San Antonio.

Augusto is married and is the father of 5 children who depend on him and are his reason for being. Because there is no electric power in his town being that it is far from an urban zone, he requested that he have a solar panel installed so that he may have power in his home to do household chores and so his children can study. When he obtained this panel, he now needed to obtain a means for payment of this debt. For this reason, he turned to Ceprodel to benefit from loans that will allow him to pay this debt and have power in his home, which he will benefit greatly from mostly because his children will be able to study in the afternoons and evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de el Sauce en el departamento de Len, el seor A gusto B. desde mas de 40 aos se dedica al negocio agropecuario en su localidad en una comarca llamada Valle San Antonio.

Es padre casado y con 5 hijos a su cargo que son el motivo de su existencia. Debido a que en su localidad no existe energa elctrica por encontrarse alejado de la zona urbana, solicit que le implantaran un panel solar para aprovechar la luz elctrica y realizar los quehaceres de su hogar y adems que sus hijos estudien. Una vez obtenido el panel, su necesidad es la obtencin de recursos para pagar esta deuda. Es por tal motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con crditos que le permitan cancelar esta deuda y as poder aprovechar la luz elctrica que le servir de mucho beneficio principalmente para que sus hijos estudien por las tardes y noche.

loan.use: Pay for a solar panel so that he may have electricity in his home.

loan.name: Bertalina

texts.es:
Bertalina Mejia is in the livestock and agriculture business in a region called Valle San Antonio in the El Sauce municipality in the city of Len. The dilemma this region faces is that because it is isolated, it does not have access to electric power. For this reason, Bertalina acquired a solar panel so that her children may study with proper lighting and so that they can do household chores that require electricity.

The problem Bertalina is facing is that when she acquired the panel, she also acquired a debt which she must now repay. Her livestock and agriculture business does not cover this expense, which is why she is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she may pay this debt with no problems so that her children may study and so that her family can do household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertalina Mejia se dedica al negocio de ganadera y agricultura en una comarca llamada Valle San Antonio en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de Len. La problemtica que presenta esta comarca es que por encontrarse alejada, no posee energa elctrica y es por tal motivo que la seora Bertalina adquiri un panel solar para aprovechar que sus hijos estudien con iluminacin y adems para realizar los quehaceres del hogar que adquieran de energa.

La problemtica que atraviesa la seora Bertalina es que al haber adquirido el panel, debe cancelar esta deuda y su negocio de ganadera y agricultura no cubre este gasto y es por esta razn que solicita crdito en CEPRODEL y de esta manera lograr salir de la deuda sin ningn problema y as lograr que sus hijos puedan estudiar con luz elctrica y tambin realizar los quehaceres del hogar.

loan.use: Pay for a solar panel so that her family may have electric power.

loan.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia Rodrguez is a single woman with the responsibility of maintaining her four small children who are of school age. She has been in the agriculture business since she was very young in the Achuapa municipality in the city of Len.

The Achuapa municipality where Claudia lives has been facing the problem of having no electric power for a very long time and thus, they have no lighting. For this reason, she has acquired a solar panel for her home. After she acquired the panel, she now had a debt to repay, and she turned to Ceprodel to receive loans that will allow her to pay for it so she may do all of her household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia Rodrguez es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus cuatro pequeos hijos en edad escolar. Se dedica desde muy jovencita a la agricultura en el municipio Achuapa en la ciudad de Len.

El municipio de Achuapa donde la seora habita, por mucho tiempo ha tenido una problemtica como lo es la ausencia de energa elctrica por lo que no cuentan con alumbrado y es por este motivo que la seora Claudia ha adquirido un panel solar en su hogar. Al haber adquirido este bien tiene la obligacin de cancelar esta deuda y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con crditos que le permitan realizar el pago del panel y as lograr adquirir la luz elctrica para realizar los quehaceres del hogar en su casa de habitacin.

loan.use: Pay for a solar panel so she may have electricity in her home.

loan.name: Elvin Francisco

texts.es:
Vicente Lpez has been in the agriculture business all his life being that he lives in a rural zone such as is the Achuapa municipality in Len. He is the father of two small children who along with his wife, a homemaker, make every effort to bring them forth successfully and educate them.

Currently, Vicentes necessity lies in that there is no electric power in his town, for which reason he acquired a solar panel and must now repay this loan. Because of this circumstance, he turns to Ceprodel to request a loan with the objective of paying this debt, which will allow him to have electricity in his home so that his children can study in the afternoons and in the evening and so they have access to a small television. In this way, it will be possible that he and his family can improve their quality of living.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Vicente Lpez durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura por vivir en una zona rural como lo es el municipio de Achuapa en Len. Es padre de familia de dos pequeos hijos que junto con su esposa que es ama de casa se esfuerzan para sacarlos adelante y puedan estudiar.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa Vicente es que en su localidad no existe luz elctrica por lo que adquiri un panel solar y le urge cancelar esta deuda. Por esta circunstancia acude a Ceprodel para solicitar crdito con el propsito de cancelar la deuda y as aprovechar de la energa elctrica principalmente para que sus nios estudian por la tarde y en la noche y adems para tener acceso a un pequeo televisor. De esta manera se hace posible que el y su familia mejoren su nivel de vida.

loan.use: Pay for a solar panel that will allow him to have electricity in his home.

loan.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina S. is originally from Achuapa near the city of Len. Throughout her life, she worked in agriculture and cattle raising. Being a woman of amazing strength, she has worked hard to support her household and cover all of her needs.

Achuapa is located is very far from the city, and is a rural town without electricity. Facing this problem, Georgina uses candles at night, but she has been working towards installing solar panels to power her house. However, each installation requires a deposit beforehand, and for this reason she is turning to Ceprodel for a loan to cover this deposit and better her living conditions. Half a solar panel can power two 50-Watt lamps and a small television. Please help with her investment in house repair so she may provide better living conditions for her children.

Translated by Lily Fu, Princeton University Language Project.

Georgina S. es una dama originaria del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de Len. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadera siendo una dama muy esforzada que a diario lucha por mantener su hogar y suplir todas las necesidades.

El municipio de Achuapa es una localidad muy alejada de la ciudad y se caracteriza por ser una zona rural que no posee energa elctrica. Ante este problema, la seora Georgina hace uso de candiles por la noche pero al ver que esta problemtica puede erradicarse, solicita un panel solar para su hogar. Una vez instalado el panel su obligacin como persona responsable es pagar esta deuda y es por esta razn que acude a Ceprodel solicitando prstamo para cubrir la deuda y mejorar la condicin de su hogar de habitacin. Por medio del panel solar tiene derecho a dos lmparas de 50 Watts y un pequeo televisor. Su anhelo es ir invirtiendo en las necesidades de su hogar para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loan.use: purchase of solar panel

loan.name: Mileidy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Farming is exhausting work, exposed to the sun and worn out from the effort it requires. Aware of this, Mileidy has earned a living farming for more than 10 years in the "municipio" of Achuapa near the Nicaraguan city of Leon.

Mileidy is a very hard-working person who thanks to the great sacrifices she's made has managed to improve her house, lacking only an investment in electric lighting, having only had lanterns for night lighting up to now. To meet this need, she's asking that a solar panel be installed at her house. She's looking for a loan from Ceprodel to get the money she needs to cover the debt and gain the benefits of being able to light her house at night.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El trabajo de agricultura requiere de mucho esfuerzo por la exposicin al sol y el desgaste fsico que este trabajo provoca. Consiente de esto la seora Mileidy C. se dedica a este negocio desde hace mas de 10 aos en el municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de Len en Nicaragua.

Mileidy se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a los grandes sacrificios que ha realizado ha logrado mejorar su casa de habitacin faltndole solamente invertir en la iluminacin ya que lo hace con candiles por la noche. Para suplir esta necesidad, solicita que le implementen un panel solar en su hogar y al obtenerlo se ve en la obligacin de pagar este panel. Es por tal razn que busca crditos en Ceprodel para obtener el dinero necesario para cubrir esta deuda y de esta manera continuar esforzndose grandemente y sacarle mas provecho a los das por medios de las actividades que le permite realizar la energa elctrica por medio del panel solar.

loan.use: Pay for solar panel.

loan.name: Pablo Ramon

texts.es:
Pablo is the father of six children, some of whom are very young, but all of whom depend on him. He makes a living farming and raising livestock. He's originally from the "municipio" of Achuapa near the city of Leon in the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

Pablo does the hard work that he has to do everyday to provide his children with the most that he can and one of his greatest hopes is that they end up with professional careers. With that goal in mind, he has invested his few resources in the basic needs of his children and he now wants to address their lack of electric power, a problem for those who live in this rural area. He's bought a solar panel that he wants to pay off as quickly as possible. Very wisely, he's approached Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him to repay the [original?] debt and be certain of not owing it so that he can begin to use the panel for his own benefit and that of his children and beloved wife.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

Pablo Caldern es un padre de seis hijos unos menores de edad y otros en la edad de la adolescencia pero todos dependientes de l. Su negocio desde pequeo ha sido en el campo con la agricultura y ganadera. Es originario del municipio Achuapa ubicado en la ciudad de Len de la bella nacin de Nicaragua.

El arduo trabajo que a diario lleva a cabo lo realiza con el propsito de brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos y uno de sus mejores anhelos es que ellos lleguen a ser profesionales de xito. Para lograr esta meta ha invertido sus pocos recursos en las necesidades de sus hijos pero hoy en da debe suplir la necesidad de ausencia de energa elctrica ya que habitan en una zona rural. Para esto ha adquirido un panel solar que debe de pagar lo mas pronto posible. Muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crdito que le permita salir de esta deuda y tener la certeza de que no debe este bien y as comenzar a usarlo sin ningun problema para beneficio directo de l , sus hijos y su querida esposa.

loan.use: Pay for a solar panel.

loan.name: Vicente

texts.es:
For more than 10 years, Vicente has earned a living from farming in the "comunidad" of Achuapa, the place where he was raised near the Nicaraguan city of Leon. He's a married men with four children who study at a small school that they have to walk very far to reach.

The problem that Vicente faces is that there's no electricity in his neighborhood because it's a rural area with few basic services. He's looking for a way to solve the problem and he's applying to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow him [to withdraw from this debt for a solar panel?] so that he can use the power from it for household chores and provide light for his children to study.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Vicente Lpez por mas de 10 aos se ha dedicado al negocio de agropecuario en la ciudad de Len especficamente en la comunidad de Achuapa que es el lugar donde se ha criado desde pequeo. Es un caballero casado y con cuatro hijos estudiando en una pequilla escuela que a diario tienen que caminar una larga distancia para llegar a ella.

Una problemtica atravesada por el seor Vicente es la ausencia de energa elctrica en su localidad por ser una zona rural que no cuenta con estos servicios bsicos. Por este motivo, el seor Vicente busca la manera de solucionar este problema y para ello acude a Ceprodel para que le brinde crdito que le permita salir de esta deuda y as aprovechar la energa tanto para los quehaceres del hogar como para que sus hijos estudien sin ningn problema.

loan.use: Pay for solar panel.

loan.name: Faviana

texts.es:
Seora Faviana H. T. Huerta belongs to the interim group "Las Rosas de Yungay" (The Roses of Yungay). Her business is located in the city of Yungay in the province of Yungay in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 300 nuevos soles, she has increased her merchandise and her income.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more fruits like oranges, apples, and bananas.

She is 31-years-old and lives with her two children. With the income that she has, she supports her children. She is very enthusiastic about belonging to an interim group of Manuela Ramos, and she will continue working to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La seora Faviana H. T. Huerta pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, su negocio esta ubicado en la localidad de Yungay, provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crdito anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su mercadera y sus ingresos.

Con este prstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertir en la compra de mas frutas como: naranjas, manzanas, pltanos

Ella tiene 31 aos, es conviviente con 2 hijos, con los ingresos que tiene apoya a sus hijos, ella esta muy entusiasmada de pertenecer a un grupo mientras tanto de Manuela Ramos y continuara trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio. .

loan.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruits so she can sell them

loan.name: Virginia Oralia

texts.es:
Mrs Virginia G. is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. She sells clothes at a stand in the Citys main market. She has been selling clothes for 13 years and now owns two market stands.

She is 41 years old; she is married and has 5 children that also help her with the business. Her husband has a car and helps her to transport the clothes from her home to the market.

She sells a great variety of clothes for children, men and women. Now she wants to use the loan to buy summer clothes.

Her objective is to keep on growing as a business woman and to create new sources of employment.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Virginia G., es una seora muy emprendedora y trabajadora, sobresaliendo con su familia en una venta de ropa, ubicado en un mercado de la ciudad capital; tiene 13 aos de vender en su puesto, actualmente cuenta con 2 puestos iguales, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales le ayudan en los puestos que ella tiene.

Es de edad de 41 aos, es casada, igual su esposo, le ayuda con un carro donde transporta la mercaderia, del mercado a su casa. Cuenta con ropa para vender, de nio, nia, mujer y hombre, en gran variedad, pero ella quiere aprovechar la poca del verano para adquirir ropa.

Tiene su visin puesta en seguir creciendo como empresaria, y crear nuevas fuentes de trabajo.

loan.use: To buy summer-clothes for children, women and men

loan.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia J. C. belongs to the communal bank Working Women of Campo Ferial. She sells breakfasts in the market of Yungay province (in Ancash department).

The previous loan she received was used as an investment in her business to improve her earnings.

Mrs.J. wants to purchase the food necessary to prepare enough breakfasts to make her business profitable. She is planning on returning the loan in four months.

Virginia is 36 years old, married with children and she works hard to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loan.use: Purchase food to prepare and sell

loan.name: Norma Elida's Group

texts.en:
Norma, Esther, and Teofila have been members of the community bank Marcela for about two years. In that time they have learned be responsible, punctual, and to save.

Norma is 41 years old. She is a single mom raising her three children. Norma runs a hostel. She has been running her business for fifteen years. Holy Week is next month and it is the biggest tourism event in the area. Norma plans to use her loan to make some repairs to her hostel in order to accommodate the tourists.

Esther is 28 years old. She lives with her partner and two young children. Teofila travels eight hours on poor roads twice per week to sell food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar in the jungle region. With loans from the community bank she has also been able to buy two motorcycle taxis, which she leases to people who drive them.

Teofila is 50 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of thirty and eight. Teofila is an artisan weaver who concentrates on blankets. She has been weaving for eight years and sells her products from her home.

Norma, Esther, and Teofila need loans of 200, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy decorations, new sheets, food staples, thread, yarn, and fabrics.

One of the most important aspects of the community banks is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Norma, Esther, and Teofila plan to use their savings to buy a home, a van, and a sewing machine for a daughter who is studying to be a tailor.

loan.use: Norma, Esther, and Teofila need loans of 200, 1500, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy decorations, new sheets, food staples, thread, yarn, and fabrics.

loan.name: Angelina

texts.es:
In January 1996 Angelina started selling cosmetics, perfumes and household products. A friend invited her to a perfume testing at her home, and thats what she started selling first. As the business prospered, in 2000 she incorporated cosmetics of renowned brands, as well as naturistic products. To date, she has been able to maintain the business, with lows and highs. The income has allowed her to pay for the education of her three children, who she wishes to eventually send to college.

Angelina wishes to buy more merchandise in order to offer new products to her clients. For this reason she is requesting a $850 loan, that she is willing to repay in five months. With your help Angelina and her family will make it.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

En enero de 1996, Angelina comenz a vender cosmticos, perfumes y artculos para el hogar, gracias a una amiga que la invit a su casa a una demostracin de perfumes, y esto fue lo primero que empez a vender. Como le empez a ir bien, en el ao 2000 incorpor tambin cosmticos de reconocidas marcas, adems de productos naturistas. Hasta la fecha ha mantenido este negocio con altas y bajas. Sin embargo el dinero que gana le sirve para poder pagar los estudios de sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Angelina desea comprar ms mercanca para poder ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes. Es por eso que est solicitando un crdito de US$ 850 que est dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. Con tu ayuda Angelina y su familia podrn salir adelante.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loan.name: Cruzkaya's Group

texts.en:
Cruzkaya, Francisca, and Tarcila have been members of the community bank Minka for between two and four years. In that time they have learned to share, to work in solidarity with others, and to smile.

Cruzkaya is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children. One of her children is four and the other is four months. She sells products such as candy and maps from a hotel in Ayacucho.

Francisca is 64 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of 39 and 27. Francisca has a tailor shop that she has owned for 36 years. Francisca also has a store where she sells a little bit of everything from food to small toys and games. She opened her store four years ago when she joined the community bank.

Tarcila is 27 years old. She is single and raising her two children. Tarcila sells jewelry. She travels to Lima twice per month to buy products that she then sells in Ayacucho.

When the group was asked what their dreams for the future were, it was Tarcilas answer that stood out. First she said she wanted to own a home so that she would have something to leave her children. She began to cry when she confessed that she had recently found out she had a possibly fatal illness that doctors could not cure. The other two associates comforted her by telling her hopeful stories about their own experiences with illness.

Cruzkaya, Francisca, and Tarcila need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy artisan products, fabric, thread, zippers, elastic, and used clothing.

loan.use: Cruzkaya, Francisca, and Tarcila need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy artisan products, fabric, thread, zippers, elastic, and used clothing.

loan.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith M. Q. is thirty-one years old. She is separated form her partner and is raising their five children with no help from him. Edith has been a member of the community bank Minka for two years. She was unable to access credit before joining the community bank because she had nothing to use as collateral. In the community bank she has found support and learned how to laugh.

In the past Edith sold shish kabobs from a cart. Since joining the community bank she has been able to start selling kitchen appliances and repair parts. She travels nine hours once or twice per week to the city of Lima to buy kitchen products and sell them in Ayacucho.

Edith needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more kitchen appliances.

Edith dreams of opening a store, and that her children will have a better life. She is making plans to open a store in the next couple of months. She has rented a location and is engaged in negotiation with the previous tenant.

loan.use: Edith needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more kitchen appliances.

loan.name: Zilghian Julisa

texts.es:
Zilgian is a 29 years old entrepreneur who lives in the 3-80 neighborhood. This young woman, eager to start her own business, decided to start a family business with her sister, using the capital they were able to accrue by saving part of their salaries. The sisters identified the opportunity of opening an Internet caf at their mothers house, as there were no other competitor businesses in the area. They have run the business for three years and they offer a variety of services, which have diversified as their clientele grows. The small business has five web access computers, a photocopier and two phone cabins for international and local calls. In order to increase their income, they plan to acquire a greater number of computers, a spiral binding machine and a scanner. But Zligians priority at present is to renovate and repaint the store, in order to improve its appearance. The income from the business has allowed this family to improve their living conditions. The sisters are very satisfied with what they have accomplished together in spite of their young age.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Zilgian es una joven microempresaria de 29 aos de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80. Esta joven deseosa de iniciar su propio negocio decide junto a su hermana de 21 aos emprender un negocio familiar, con capital propio, ya que siempre han ahorrado parte de los ingresos que perciban de su trabajo. Las hermanas vieron la necesidad de montar un Cyber Caf en la vivienda de su madre, ya que en esa zona no existe ningn Cyber que le pueda generar competencia. El negocio ya tiene tres aos de existencia, y ofrece una variedad de servicios, los cuales se han ido diversificando a medida que va aumentando el nmero de clientes. El negocio es pequeo y cuenta con cinco computadoras con servicio de Internet, una fotocopiadora y dos cabinas para realizar llamadas nacionales e internacionales. Las expectativas de estas jvenes son las de adquirir un mayor nmero de mquinas, comprar una encolochadora y un escner, de modo de aumentar sus ganancias. La prioridad de Zligian en estos momentos es la remodelar las paredes del local y pintarlo, dando as una mejor presentacin al negocio. Los ingresos del negocio le han permitido a esta familia mejorar su nivel de vida y vivir en condiciones dignas. Las hermanas se sienten satisfechas con lo que juntas han logrado, a pesar de su corta edad.

loan.use: Purchase of cement, sand, iron, stone and paint.

loan.name: Diana Aurora

texts.es:
Diana began selling perfumes in February 2003. She had sold clothing and cosmetics before but after finding that a well-known perfume shop in her neighborhood sold perfumes at wholesale prices, she began selling perfumes. Her business has gone well, selling first to friends and, little by little, to others who have been recommended to her. Thanks to this business, Diana can help her husband, who doesn't earn much, with the school expenses of their two children.

Diana now wants to buy more merchandise so that she can have a wider range for her customers. Consequently, she's asking for a US$925 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, that she can use to help her family get ahead. With the additional products she'll buy, she'll attract more customers. With your help, Diana can get ahead and help her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Diana comenz a vender perfumes en Febrero del 2003 primero vendiendo ropa y cosmticos, pero despus se enter de una reconocida casa de perfumes de la localidad que venda a precios de mayoreo y fue as como empez con la venta de perfumes y le fue muy bien, primero entres sus amistades y actualmente en su casa tiene un letrero donde se anuncia, poco a poco la gente va reconociendo el establecimiento de Diana. Gracias a esto Diana a logrado brindarle un apoyo a su esposo que no gana mucho y con la ayuda de Diana han logrado pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos en la escuela.

Sin embargo Diana, desea comprar ms mercanca para poder tener variedad para sus clientes. Es por eso que est solicitando un crdito de US $925 que est dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Diana podr sacar adelante a su familia, ya que con los productos que comprar, tendr ms gente que le compre. Con tu ayuda Diana lograr salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Eteldita

texts.es:
Eteldita is a member of Las Doncellas comunal bank, located in AA.HH. Primavera II etapa Mz. 26 Lt. 23, Manatay district, department of Ucayali. She is a 33 year old mother to three children, and her husband is a vendor. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the purchase and sale of beauty products.

Currently she continues to sell beauty products of a wide variety of brands, and also does work such as manicures. Because of her work, she needs to constantly be out looking for clients and collecting payments, but she also makes time to be with her family.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products such as perfumes, shadows, powders, creams, etc., and nail polishes of different colors.

When Eteldita began this business, she started with a few products, but thanks to the loans from Manuela Ramos, she has been purchasing more and her income is increasing which will help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La seora Eteldita pertenece al banco comunal Las Doncellas, ubicado en el AA. HH. Primavera II etapa Mz. 26 Lt. 23, distrito de Manantay, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 aos, es madre de 3 hijos y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer prstamo que recibi de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la compra y venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad sigue vendiendo productos de belleza de diversas marcas, as como tambin realiza trabajos de manicura, por motivo de los negocios tiene que salir constantemente a buscar clientes y para realizar cobranzas, pero se da un tiempo para estar en familia.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de productos de belleza como perfumes, sombras, talcos, cremas, etc., y esmaltes de diferentes colores.

Cuando Eteldita se inici en el negocio empez con pocos productos gracias a los prstamos recibidos de Manuela Ramos est comprando ms y sus ingresos aumentan para el bien de su familia.

loan.use: Purchase beauty products

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Seora Rosa belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Brave Women), which is located at 296 Jr. Lima Nin the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 59-years-old, has 6 children, is married, and her husband is a merchant.

Currently, the grocery store that she owns has grown more. Now she sells more products than before with the support of her children, who take turns attending to the store. At night, she sells regional food outside her home.

With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc., and supplies to prepare the food that she sells.

Rosa has a very noble character and is very kind. This is why her grocery store is very frequented and loved by her neighbors. She tells us that it's always nice to have a smile for someone. She is also very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all of the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La seora Rosa pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Lima N 296, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 59 aos, 6 hijos, es casada y su esposo es comerciante.

En la actualidad la bodega que posee ha crecido ms, ahora vende mas productos que antes con el apoyo de sus hijos, los cuales se turnan para la atencin y en las noches vende comida regional en la vereda de su casa.

Con el prstamo de S/.1,500, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de arroz, azcar, leche, fideos, etc., y vveres para la venta de sus comidas.

Rosa tiene una carcter muy noble y es muy bondadosa, es por eso que su bodega es muy concurrida y es muy querida por sus vecinos, siempre es bueno tener una sonrisa para alguien, nos dice ella, adems est muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado.

loan.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.) and supplies to prepare food

loan.name: Rosita Miscksy

texts.es:
Rosita goes to the comunal bank of Las Doncellas, located in AA. HH. Primavera II etapa Mz. 30 Lt. 5, District of Manantay, department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and is the mother of two children. She maintains her living with her small groceries store. She gets up early every morning to make breakfast for her family and then goes to work. (Rosita is also grateful for Manuela Ramoss help, which allows her to work from home and be more independent while spending more time with her children.) With a loan of 1000 soles, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will be able to invest in a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, half a carton of milk and soda for her store. Please help her with this investment.

Translated by Lily Fu, Princeton University Language Project

La seora Rosita pertenece al banco comunal Las Doncellas, ubicado en el AA. HH. Primavera II etapa Mz. 30 Lt. 5, distrito de Manantay, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 aos y es madre de 2 hijos. En la actualidad cuenta con un motocarro y una bodega. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo y atender su venta. Con el prstamo de S/.1,000 el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azcar, caja de leche y gaseosas, los cuales le permitirn implementar ms su bodega. Rosita est agradecida con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos porque puede trabajar de manera independiente sin salir de su casa, eso le permite estar ms tiempo con sus hijos.

loan.use: Purchase Groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.)

loan.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia belongs to the Community Bank Mujeres Valientes, located in Jr. Guillermo Sisley S/N, Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 57 years old, a mother of three, whose husband works in retail. At the moment she has a shop selling spare car parts, as well as a garage. She works with her husband and children, who share the different roles within the business and domestic tasks. With the loan of S/.3000 which she received from Manuela Ramos, which she will pay within 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of car parts such as tyres, tyre chains, balance wheels, gears, fixed wheels, etc. And the rest of the money will be invested in the maintenance of the garage. Virginias family-run business is growing, as is her income, which is creating more capital, allowing her to continue buying products. Furthermore, she is happy with all she has achieved so far.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La seora Virgnia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley S/N, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 57 aos, es madre D. 3 hijos y su esposo es comerciante. En la actualidad tiene una tienda D. venta D. repuestos D. motos, tambin un taller D. mecnica. Trabaja junto a su esposo e hijos y se distribuyen distintas funciones en el negocio y en las labores domsticas. Con el prstamo que recibi D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.3,000, el cual pagar en 4 meses, invertir en la compra D. repuestos D. motos como llantas, cadenas, catalinas, rodajes, piones, etc. y otra parte del capital lo destinar al taller D. mecnica para su mantenimiento. Virginia, con el trabajo familiar que realiza en el negocio, ste est creciendo al igual que sus ingresos, los cuales generan mayor capital para seguir comprando ms productos, adems est muy feliz D. todos lo logros obtenidos hasta el momento.

loan.use: To purchase spare car parts

loan.name: Julia Lionila

texts.es:
Julia Lionila C. Alfonso, who belongs to the Community Bank Mujeres de Grandes Retos, sells fabric. Her business is located in the district and province of Huaraz, in Ancash. With her previous loan of S/.1500 she has bought fabric, thus increasing her income. She will invest this new loan of S/. 3000, which will be paid off within 4 months, in buying greater quantities of fabric, of different quality, in order to supply her business with more products and increase sales. She is 49 years old, a single mother with 4 children who are now adults. Her income enables her to support her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La seora Julia Lionila C. Alfonso, pertence al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, ella se dedica ala venta de telas, su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash, Con el prstamo anterior de S/. 1,500 nuevos soles, ha comprado telas al por mayor incrementando sus ingresos, Con este prstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles el cual ser cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertir en comprar mas cantidad de telas de distintas calidades par surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Ella tiene 49 aos de edad es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes, su ingreso le permite ayudar a su nietos.

loan.use: The loan will be used to buy fabric for her business

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs.Julia S. C. is 48 years old and attended school up to the third grade. She has four children that no longer live with her. She lives in Asentamiento Humano Vctor Ral in the Porvenir District, Trujillo Province of La Libertad Department of Peru

Her business in the summer is selling sandals and in the winter she sells more rugged footwear. Her sales route takes her to northern cities like Sullana and Tambo Grande. To complement her ernings, she owns a taxi which operates from Trujillo to Asentamiento Humano Gran Chim.

Mrs.Julia began selling plastic products such as buckets but her earnings were insufficient. She decided to change her product offering to shoes and began making enough money for her to purchase the taxi. Mrs.Julia belongs to the communal bank "Millenium Women", which is where she obtained her first microcredit to purchase plastic products.

The microcredit she is requesting will be used to fix a broken pump in her taxi. She also plans to purchase two dozen sandals to sell to her female clientele.

Mrs.Julias dream is to purchase a second taxi which her husband would drive along the same route. A second taxi would allow her to maximize the potential of this busy route.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loan.use: Car repair and purchase sandals to sell

loan.name: Constatina's Group

texts.en:
Constatina and Neli have been members of the community bank Ollantay II for thirteen and eight years respectively. In that time they have learned about responsibility and punctuality. They have learned how to treat their children and have healthy relationships with their family.

Constatina is 42 years old. She lives with her partner and three daughters. Constatina has a small store where she sells food staples such as flour, sugar, and rice. She opened her store seven months ago. Before opening her store she worked as an artisan with her brother. When he passed away she found herself unable to continue in that line of work.

Neli is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. Neli sells wood products for building. In addition, she makes and sells furniture. She has been running this business for seventeen years. She travels eight hours by poor roads to the jungle area to buy wood two to three times per month. She also recently used her savings to buy a van, which is used to transport people between towns in the region.

Constatina and Neli need loans of 600, and 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to add a public telephone to their store, and to buy more wood.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Both Constatina and Neli have recently used their savings to open their store and to buy a van. Their dreams are to continue moving forward, and that their children will have a better life.

loan.use: Constatina and Neli need loans of 600 and 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to add a public telephone to their store and to buy more wood.

loan.name: Santos Elena

texts.es:
Santos Elena, 45, studied through high school. She now has three children, two of whom still live with her. She lives in the Human Victor Raul settlement in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She raises farm animals such as ducks and chickens and fattens them for sale in the nearby Santa Rosa market.
